gd-1009612103889,glassdoor,https://www.glassdoor.ca/job-listing/j?jl=1009612103889,,Research and Data Coordinator – Housing & Infrastructure ~ Competition #2025-006,Assembly of Manitoba Chiefs,Winnipeg,2025-01-25,,direct_data,yearly,48800.0,79800.0,CAD,False,,,organic,,"**Research and Data Coordinator \~ Competition \#2025\-006**
**Category: Full\-Time Term – with possibility of extension**
**Closing Date: February 6, 2025**
**Position Summary**

The Research and Data Coordinator is responsible for conceptualizing, researching, gathering \& assembling information. Responsible for researching various policies regarding Housing and Infrastructure, providing data and details for media statements, and drafting research documents and recommendations for an effective First Nations decision\-making process related to Housing and Infrastructure for First Nations in Manitoba.
**Key Responsibilities**
* Conduct research and data and provide supporting information for briefing notes, reports, and other written materials for internal and external audiences.
* Conduct research and data needed to develop media statements.
* Create various statistics, data, spreadsheets, charts, and presentations pertinent to the various projects and research tasks.
* Ability to retrieve information and data through outside sources, such as the “Freedom of Information Act” or the archives.
* Stay current with the various Housing and Infrastructure issues specific to First Nations.
* Provide support with the research and data collection for different areas of housing specific to First Nations.
* Research policy and governance functions of Housing in First Nations.
* Conducted statistical research and prepared draft presentations.
* Basic data analysis and summary preparations.
* Support the success of work plans, tasking, and setting benchmarks by management.
* Draft higher\-level presentations when needed and specific to strategies, discussion papers, and position papers.
* Adhere to office policies and procedures and confidentiality.
* Perform any other related duties as assigned by management.
**Qualifications, Education \& Experience**
* Bachelor’s or graduate degree in Education, Communications, or related fields. An equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered.
* Demonstrates data management skills.
* Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.
* Demonstrates problem\-solving and organization skills.
* Knowledge of First Nation’s policies and political issues in Housing and Infrastructure would be an asset.
* Excellent time management skills.
* Reliable, trustworthy, and dependable.
* Ability to work closely with others, independently or as a member of a multi\-disciplinary team of professionals.
* Ability to follow office procedures, practices, and confidentiality.
* Demonstrates problem\-solving and organizational skills.
* Proficient use of Microsoft Office software, including Word, Excel, and Outlook.
* Adhere to AMC policies and procedures with specific attention to attendance and professional ethics.
* Possess a valid Class 5F Driver’s License, work flexible hours, and travel upon request.
* A satisfactory Child Abuse Registry Check and Criminal Record Check are required.

Interested applicants are invited to submit their cover letter identifying the position title and quote competition number applying for qualifications, resume, and 3 professional reference listings (including a most recent employer reference) by **4:00 p.m. February 7, 2025** to:
**Human Resources**
**Assembly of Manitoba Chiefs**
**14th Floor, 275 Portage Avenue, Winnipeg, Manitoba R3B 2B3**
**Quote Competition \#2025\-006 in your application.**
**For best results, submit your application to BambooHR**
https://manitobachiefs.com/about/job\-opportunities/
We thank all who apply and advise that only those selected for further consideration will be contacted. No phone calls will be accepted.

Preference will be given to First Nations people. If successful, applicants will be asked to verify citizenship documentation issued by a First Nation or government\-issued documentation or affirmation from Inuit, Métis, or non\-status Indigenous community with which they identify. Incomplete and late applications will not be considered.
**Please visit our website at** **www.manitobachiefs.com**",,https://www.glassdoor.ca/Overview/W-EI_IE5358526.htm,,,,,,,research assistant,2025-01-25

gd-1009611931193,glassdoor,https://www.glassdoor.ca/job-listing/j?jl=1009611931193,,"Senior Research Assistant, Children of Russlaender Mennonites: Building Family and Community in Canada",University of Winnipeg,Winnipeg,2025-01-25,,direct_data,hourly,18.0,18.0,CAD,False,,,organic,"_resources@uwinnipeg.ca, _resources@uwinnipeg.ca","Senior Research Assistants are normally graduate students, or University of Winnipeg undergraduate students, employed to assist in the execution and evaluation of research projects in their area of study. The positions may oversee Research Assistants in areas such as the use of proper techniques, analysis, and documentation.

Senior Research Assistants work under the general supervision or direction of more senior researchers or faculty members, and are expected to exercise judgment in prioritizing, planning and organizing their own work within defined parameters.
**Position Overview:**

The Senior Research Assistant will support the oral project, Children of Russlaender Mennonites: Building Family and Community in Canada, by assisting in the transcriptions of interviews. The transcriber must maintain confidentiality of sensitive interview content and deliver transcripts within agreed\-upon deadlines.
**Duties:**
The duties include producing precise, well\-formatted transcripts of English language interviews that adherence to oral history transcription guidelines.
**Qualifications:**
* The successful candidate must have strong communication and organizational skills, attention to detail, willingness to learn, and good work ethic.
* Knowledge of Mennonite history in imperial Russia/Soviet Union would be an asset.
**Condition(s) of Employment:**
* **Must be legally entitled to work in Canada.**
The period of work will be from **January 31, 2025 \- August 31, 2025**, and the estimated total hours of work will be **0\-70 hours**.
***Note****: This position is represented by the Public Service Alliance of Canada \- Research Capacity Unit.*
**Note:** The work described in this posting will be conducted remotely.

• *The Unit**

The Centre for the Advancement of Teaching and Learning (The Centre) is a faculty development unit that works in collaboration with faculty and graduate students to provide leadership, expertise, and support in fulfilling the teaching and learning mission of the University of Manitoba (UM). The Centre contributes to the practice and scholarship of teaching through guidance, collaborative problem-solving, and research with respect to teaching and learning effectiveness, curriculum planning, and institutional policies and infrastructure to optimize the learning and teaching experiences of students and faculty.
• *The Position**

The Research Lead - Science of Teaching and Learning manages Science of Teaching and Learning, Teaching and Learning Research, and Scholarship of Teaching and Learning activities as they relate to fulfilling The Centre’s mandate to support, promote, and celebrate excellence and innovation in teaching and learning. Through the Centre, the Research Lead - Science of Teaching and Learning will play a critical role in supporting the development and implementation of evidence-based teaching and learning strategies within the UM and managing the Research, Curriculum Renewal & Program Evaluation, and Quality Assurance Portfolios within The Centre.
• *Position Duties**:
• *Lead - Science of Teaching and Learning - 50%**

In this description, research is related to the scholarship of teaching and learning and the science of teaching and learning as well as other applied research and evaluation related to teaching and learning.
• *Day-to-day activities Include (but are not limited to)**:
- Conceptualize, develop, lead, and evaluate University-wide research projects related to the portfolio of the Vice-Provost (Teaching and Learning).

- Conceptualize and lead The Centre’s science of teaching and learning and teaching and learning research portfolio and maintain a productive research agenda aligned with The Centre mandate and UM Strategic Plan.
- Lead The Centre team responsible for conducting curriculum renewal and program evaluation, and quality assurance within the research and evaluation portfolio.
- Conceptualize, lead, develop, and report on all quality assurance processes related to The Centre’s programs and initiatives.

- Conceptualize, lead, and engage in knowledge mobilization to distribute findings from the sciences of teaching and learning, teaching and learning research, evaluation, and quality assurance activities to various audiences (e.g., peer-reviewed journals, relevant conference presentations, reports, and educational materials) within The Centre, the UM, and externally (provincially, nationally, and internationally).
- Review projects and related activities to ensure alignment with The Centre mandate and University of Manitoba Strategic plan.

- Establish tactics and priorities for The Centre’s research and evaluation projects, distribute resources to projects (e.g., personnel, budget), and implement plans for successful project completion.
- Promote and represent The Centre in coalitions, meetings, conferences and communicate with various internal (UM) and external stakeholders.

- Represent The Centre and act as a consultant to UM-wide Committees on advanced and emerging issues related to academic integrity, science of teaching and learning, student reflections of instruction, etc.

- Advance science of teaching and learning, teaching and learning research, and the scholarship of teaching and learning (SoTL) across UM by building capacity among faculty/instructors to engage in these types of research.
- Build a teaching and learning research community/network within UM.
- Participate in The Centre’s strategic plan development and ensure goals related to research, evaluation, and quality assurance are realized.
• *Management (Project and Personnel) - 40%**
- Manage all research and evaluation projects that are UM-wide related to the portfolio of the Vice-Provost (Teaching and Learning).
- Manage all The Centre’s teaching and learning research and evaluation projects from beginning to completion.
- Gather evidence and generate technical and research reports with an aim to enhance teaching and learning practices, policies, and initiatives within UM and higher education.
- Manage and coordinate the activities of the Science of Teaching and Learning Team to accomplish and meet research and evaluation project milestones.
- Report on the performance of the Science of Teaching and Learning team during all phases of research and evaluation projects.
- Manage the budgets, processes, personnel, and resources for Centre research and evaluation initiatives.
- Manage grants (internal and external) related to research and evalu",,,,,,,,,research assistant,2025-01-25

Description

Grow with the best. Join a smart, creative, and inspired team that works to support operational excellence. The Stantec community unites more than 31,000 employees working in over 400 locations across 6 continents. Our Functional Services Teams (FSTs) include Corporate Development, Finance, Human Resources, HSSE, IT, Legal, Marketing/Communications, Practice Services and Real Estate and Procurement. Bringing together individuals with diverse backgrounds, talents, and expertise, our FSTs are vital to making our Company stronger.
Your Opportunity

We have an exciting opportunity for a Project Coordinator to join our Research Services team where you will provide essential support and play a crucial part in the successful execution of various projects and initiatives. Stantec’s Research Services team, as part of the Innovation Office, supports employees by providing resources for research, publication, academic collaboration, and related intellectual property management, enhancing project impact and technical expertise. They also assist with claiming research-related tax credits, offering financial benefits that contribute to Stantec’s growth and innovation.
Your Key Responsibilities
• Fully understand the scope of our Research Services programs, including tax credit programs, eLibrary, and academic collaborations and support the program lead in these areas.
• Communicate effectively with internal team members, leadership, financial and tax managers, consultants, and anyone at Stantec seeking support from Research Services.
• Serve as a general liaison for team coordination and communication.

• Assist the team with invoice processing, collaborate with Stantec’s tax and financial team to issue invoices promptly and follow up on outstanding invoices and monitor and track consultant invoices.
• Process orders and support other team members with expense reports and timecards, if required.
• Provide administrative support to Research Services team members as needed.
• Compile, compose, type, and proofread correspondence and various other documents.
• Prepare forms and reports, ensuring they are understandable, timely, and useful.
• Accumulate, compile, consolidate, and edit data, checking document contents for accuracy.
• Create and edit spreadsheets, letters, memoranda, etc., from drafts and general instructions.
• Schedule meetings and coordinate travel, hotel workspaces, itineraries, and arrangements if required.
• Attend meetings and work cooperatively with all team members to transcribe meeting notes.
• Maintain project team directories, file emails, and communicate changes or process updates to the team both internally and externally.
Qualifications
Your Capabilities and Credentials
• Proficient in MS Office, with advanced skills in MS Excel, Teams, and SharePoint.
• Ability to learn new software systems.
• Experience with Financial/Cost systems (e.g., Oracle) is preferred.
• Possess a “can do” and “will do” attitude, taking charge of any assignment given.
• Strong work ethic and willingness to go the extra mile.
• Must be willing and able to take initiative when needed.
• Experience working in a team environment and understanding the importance of being a team player.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
• Self-motivated with the ability to prioritize and communicate with multiple groups.
• High attention to detail is essential.
• Strong organizational and time management skills.
• Ability to prioritize and organize multiple concurrent assignments.
• Adaptability and flexibility to learn new things and pick up tasks quickly.
• Willingness to learn and accept feedback.
• Basic understanding of accounting principles.
• Prior work in a project coordinator/assistant role is a plus.
• Extensive experience assisting management in day-to-day operations and project-related administrative tasks.
• Ability to perform effectively under pressure in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
• Capable of performing repetitive tasks with a high level of proficiency and accuracy.
• Experience should demonstrate sound judgment, the ability to multi-task, complete tasks in a timely manner, and work effectively under pressure.
• Experience with data management, accounting, finance, or business is preferred.
Education and Experience
• Bachelor’s degree preferred.
• At least three (3) years of related project administrative experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
• Experience working in the Engineering industry is a plus.

This description is not a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that may be required of the employee and other duties, responsibilities and activities may be assigned or may be changed at any time with or without notice.

The **Student Laboratory Assistant is a part\-time (4\-16 hours per week) term position** that will aid in the maintenance of the Chemistry department’s chemical Inventory of 4000\+ chemicals. The incumbent will be working in the Chemistry department’s main supply and storage room. The job will entail relabeling chemical bottles to meet WHMIS 2015 regulations, entering descriptive information into chemical inventory software, and reorganization of chemical storage cabinets. Other duties as assigned to assist in the cleanliness and safety of the storage areas.
**Responsibilities:**

* Relabel (according to WHMIS 2015 spec) and clean chemical storage bottles for use in undergraduate labs and research labs. Inventory may need to be rearranged to meet current curriculum and safety. Direction will be given by Chemistry laboratory technician staff as required.
* Perform data entry into chemical inventory software or Excel. Information entered will be pertaining to each chemical.
* Prepare/revise inventory lists for each chemical storage cabinet. (Training provided by technician staff)
* Compose lists of chemicals requiring disposal and hand off these chemicals to the technician.
* Other administrative duties (eg. submission of safety forms).
* Replacement of chemical stock bottles, refilling prepared solutions and solid mixtures into new bottles and vials.
* Light dusting or wiping down may also be required.
**Qualifications:**
* Must have completed second year of undergraduate studies, declaration of either a Biochemistry or Chemistry as a major.
* Must be comfortable working with chemicals of varying hazards.
* Must have strong computer skills, familiarity with Windows and MS Excel.
* Strong attention to detail.
* Good organizational skills.
**An equivalent combination of education, experience, skills, knowledge and abilities may be considered.**
**Condition(s) of Employment:**
* Must be legally entitled to work in Canada.

* To be eligible for a Student Assistant role you must be a full\-time student. Full\-time students are defined as students enrolled in the current academic year in a high school or at the University of Winnipeg in a full\-time program of study as defined in the University of Winnipeg General Calendar.
* Must be comfortable working in a fume hood and/or wearing half\-face respirator as required.
* Must be able to lift 20 kg.
* Must be comfortable working in tight spaces.
**Note:** The work described in this posting will be conducted in\-person.

Overview:

The Quality Control Supervisor’s role is to perform and coordinate the quality control/assurance functions in the Precast division i.e. Precast & Hollowcore plants including all processes required to plan and execute our work as well as to oversee/audit the quality of manufactured precast products. The incumbent is responsible for all activities relating to development and maintenance of our precast quality assurance program in all areas of our operations.
• *Responsibilities**:
• *Marketing and Customer Relations**:
- Demonstrates continuous effort to improve operations, decrease turnaround times, streamline work processes, and work cooperatively and jointly to provide quality seamless customer service.
- Establish relationships and network with customer.

- Maintain positive working relationship with precast concrete supplier to ensure that appropriate specifications are written and that sufficient receiving inspections are performed on products ordered and received.
- Develop the knowledge and expertise in the Q/C department.
- Quality interface and networking with other ready mix concrete and precasters, Lafarge companies and outside organizations.
- Provide assistance to marketing and sales department in the planning (estimating stage) of a project that requires specific and/or specialized input.

- Oversee objectives, educate and review performance for all reports in the Q/C department.
- Develop knowledge and expertise in the concrete technology.
- Direct and train the Quality Control Technician team members.
- Works directly with project managers, precast engineers, plant managers and supervisors.
- Promote safety awareness.
• *Planning**
- Manage and direct daily tasks for the Q/C technicians.
- Participate in the planning of any new product development initiative.
- Oversee any specific quality plan in any department that is required to execute a job successfully.
- Schedule regular testing of equipment and materials.

- Supervising Q/C technicians in carrying out testes and checks.
- Review and update of the CSA/PCI/CPCI Quality Manual System and audit of the system.
- Oversee and maintain our testing capability (includes people and equipment).
- Monitoring and ensuring the Quality Assurance program is followed.
- Writes or reviews technical and performance specifications, quality standards, sampling plans, and inspections procedures.
- Reviews receiving inspections of materials, supplies and equipment.
- Reviews certificates of compliance or test reports to determine validity.
- Analyzes product test data and writes evaluation reports.
- Ensuring established polices and regulations related to quality control are followed
- Audit and measurement of compliance.
- Project trouble shooting.
- Write plans and procedures and monitor cost for R&D Projects.
• *Financial**
- Ensure that budget is met
- Review testing invoices.
• *Specific Accountabilities**:
- For participating in the planning of projects with specific reference to quality.
- Ensure compliance with all laws and company Q/C and Q/A guidelines and policies.
- Ensure customer satisfaction with excellent product and service quality.
- Demonstrating leadership with respect to quality and process improvement.

- More than 5 years of experience in construction industry. Precast industry experience is an asset.
- Knowledge of industrial and commercial building construction practices.
- Must be able to attain PCI Level I/II within 1-year time.
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
- Good organization, supervisory and planning skills.
- Strong team player with a positive attitude.
- Good working knowledge of cementitious materials as well as concrete properties/characteristics

zr-Jrhm4MDHez5BEOk1zWUcJQ,zip_recruiter,https://www.ziprecruiter.com/jobs//j?lvk=Jrhm4MDHez5BEOk1zWUcJQ,,Plant Director - WG947,Summit Search Group,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-25,,,,,,,,,,organic,Gail.Eckert@summitsearchgroup.com,"**The Position:**

Summit Search Grouphas partnered withExceldor Cooperative,an Award\-Winning, longstanding Manitoba\-based organization. On their behalf, we seek to recruit their newest Plant Director to join their Blumenort location. Reporting to the VP Operations Chicken Division and Major Projects, the Plant Director is responsible for planning, leading, organizing, and controlling all activities at the Blumenort plant. This includes overseeing production, maintenance, sanitation, engineering, continuous improvement, and distribution. The Director will ensure that business objectives are met and exceeded while achieving financial and operational KPIs.

Collaborating closely with the quality team, the Plant Director will implement and enhance quality systems, ensure food safety, uphold customer specifications, and consistently maintain high standards. With a leadership approach that places people at the core of performance, the Director will foster a culture of excellence and drive the plants success.

Our ideal candidate is a results\-driven leader with extensive experience in plant operations and a proven track record of achieving financial and operational goals. They are highly skilled in fostering collaboration, developing teams, and driving continuous improvement while maintaining a strong commitment to quality, food safety, and customer satisfaction. With a people\-focused leadership style, they inspire excellence, prioritize team engagement, and consistently deliver exceptional performance.
**Key Responsibilities:**

* Records Management: Establish and maintain proper procedures for managing departmental documentation, including processing yields for optimal results.
* Quality Assurance: Support the development and maintenance of a Quality Assurance Program, train teams on QA standards, implement those standards, and resolve cross\-departmental quality issues.

* Team Leadership: Provide direction to teams, set clear expectations, and delegate authority effectively to align with strategic goals and achieve high performance.

* Establish and Maintain Preventative OHS: Adhere to Health and Safety policies and procedures while working in the plant ensuring safety of all plant employees.

* 10\+ years experience leading high\-performing teams within the food industry.
* Proven experience achieving results and fostering collaboration among departments and teams.
* Sound understanding of the meat and poultry processing industries, with expertise in operational excellence.
* A recognized leader who prioritizes open communication, employee engagement, training, and team\-oriented management.
* Proactive and analytical, with strong problem\-solving and judgement abilities.
* Bilingual considered a strong asset.

Compensation Group: Other Academic

• *The Unit**

The Centre for the Advancement of Teaching and Learning (The Centre) is a faculty development unit that works in collaboration with faculty and graduate students to provide leadership, expertise, and support in fulfilling the teaching and learning mission of the University of Manitoba (UM). The Centre contributes to the practice and scholarship of teaching through guidance, collaborative problem-solving, and research with respect to teaching and learning effectiveness, curriculum planning, and institutional policies and infrastructure to optimize the learning and teaching experiences of students and faculty.
• *The Position**

The Research Lead - Science of Teaching and Learning manages Science of Teaching and Learning, Teaching and Learning Research, and Scholarship of Teaching and Learning activities as they relate to fulfilling The Centre’s mandate to support, promote, and celebrate excellence and innovation in teaching and learning. Through the Centre, the Research Lead - Science of Teaching and Learning will play a critical role in supporting the development and implementation of evidence-based teaching and learning strategies within the UM and managing the Research, Curriculum Renewal & Program Evaluation, and Quality Assurance Portfolios within The Centre.
• *Position Duties**:
• *Lead - Science of Teaching and Learning - 50%**

In this description, research is related to the scholarship of teaching and learning and the science of teaching and learning as well as other applied research and evaluation related to teaching and learning.
• *Day-to-day activities Include (but are not limited to)**:
- Conceptualize, develop, lead, and evaluate University-wide research projects related to the portfolio of the Vice-Provost (Teaching and Learning).

- Conceptualize and lead The Centre’s science of teaching and learning and teaching and learning research portfolio and maintain a productive research agenda aligned with The Centre mandate and UM Strategic Plan.
- Lead The Centre team responsible for conducting curriculum renewal and program evaluation, and quality assurance within the research and evaluation portfolio.
- Conceptualize, lead, develop, and report on all quality assurance processes related to The Centre’s programs and initiatives.

- Conceptualize, lead, and engage in knowledge mobilization to distribute findings from the sciences of teaching and learning, teaching and learning research, evaluation, and quality assurance activities to various audiences (e.g., peer-reviewed journals, relevant conference presentations, reports, and educational materials) within The Centre, the UM, and externally (provincially, nationally, and internationally).
- Review projects and related activities to ensure alignment with The Centre mandate and University of Manitoba Strategic plan.

- Establish tactics and priorities for The Centre’s research and evaluation projects, distribute resources to projects (e.g., personnel, budget), and implement plans for successful project completion.
- Promote and represent The Centre in coalitions, meetings, conferences and communicate with various internal (UM) and external stakeholders.

- Represent The Centre and act as a consultant to UM-wide Committees on advanced and emerging issues related to academic integrity, science of teaching and learning, student reflections of instruction, etc.

- Advance science of teaching and learning, teaching and learning research, and the scholarship of teaching and learning (SoTL) across UM by building capacity among faculty/instructors to engage in these types of research.
- Build a teaching and learning research community/network within UM.
- Participate in The Centre’s strategic plan development and ensure goals related to research, evaluation, and quality assurance are realized.
• *Management (Project and Personnel) - 40%**
- Manage all research and evaluation projects that are UM-wide related to the portfolio of the Vice-Provost (Teaching and Learning).
- Manage all The Centre’s teaching and learning research and evaluation projects from beginning to completion.
- Gather evidence and generate technical and research reports with an aim to enhance teaching and learning practices, policies, and initiatives within UM and higher education.
- Manage and coordinate the activities of the Science of Teaching and Learning Team to accomplish and meet research and evaluation project milestones.
- Report on the performance of the Science of Teaching and Learning team during all phases of research and evaluation projects.
- Manage the budgets, processes, personnel, and resources for Centre research and evaluation initiatives.
- Manage grants (internal and external) related to research and evalu",,,,,,,,,research assistant,2025-01-26

go-VSEjWrxCu3fJsVlpAAAAAA==,google,https://stantec.jobs/winnipeg-mb/project-coordinator-research-services/430C427E3DB54493BB3DFCC029866F75/job/?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,"Project Coordinator, Research Services",Stantec,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-08,,,,,,,False,,,,,"Project Coordinator, Research Services - ( 240004HA )
Description

Grow with the best. Join a smart, creative, and inspired team that works to support operational excellence. The Stantec community unites more than 31,000 employees working in over 400 locations across 6 continents. Our Functional Services Teams (FSTs) include Corporate Development, Finance, Human Resources, HSSE, IT, Legal, Marketing/Communications, Practice Services and Real Estate and Procurement. Bringing together individuals with diverse backgrounds, talents, and expertise, our FSTs are vital to making our Company stronger.
Your Opportunity

We have an exciting opportunity for a Project Coordinator to join our Research Services team where you will provide essential support and play a crucial part in the successful execution of various projects and initiatives. Stantec’s Research Services team, as part of the Innovation Office, supports employees by providing resources for research, publication, academic collaboration, and related intellectual property management, enhancing project impact and technical expertise. They also assist with claiming research-related tax credits, offering financial benefits that contribute to Stantec’s growth and innovation.
Your Key Responsibilities
• Fully understand the scope of our Research Services programs, including tax credit programs, eLibrary, and academic collaborations and support the program lead in these areas.
• Communicate effectively with internal team members, leadership, financial and tax managers, consultants, and anyone at Stantec seeking support from Research Services.
• Serve as a general liaison for team coordination and communication.

• Assist the team with invoice processing, collaborate with Stantec’s tax and financial team to issue invoices promptly and follow up on outstanding invoices and monitor and track consultant invoices.
• Process orders and support other team members with expense reports and timecards, if required.
• Provide administrative support to Research Services team members as needed.
• Compile, compose, type, and proofread correspondence and various other documents.
• Prepare forms and reports, ensuring they are understandable, timely, and useful.
• Accumulate, compile, consolidate, and edit data, checking document contents for accuracy.
• Create and edit spreadsheets, letters, memoranda, etc., from drafts and general instructions.
• Schedule meetings and coordinate travel, hotel workspaces, itineraries, and arrangements if required.
• Attend meetings and work cooperatively with all team members to transcribe meeting notes.
• Maintain project team directories, file emails, and communicate changes or process updates to the team both internally and externally.
Qualifications
Your Capabilities and Credentials
• Proficient in MS Office, with advanced skills in MS Excel, Teams, and SharePoint.
• Ability to learn new software systems.
• Experience with Financial/Cost systems (e.g., Oracle) is preferred.
• Possess a “can do” and “will do” attitude, taking charge of any assignment given.
• Strong work ethic and willingness to go the extra mile.
• Must be willing and able to take initiative when needed.
• Experience working in a team environment and understanding the importance of being a team player.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
• Self-motivated with the ability to prioritize and communicate with multiple groups.
• High attention to detail is essential.
• Strong organizational and time management skills.
• Ability to prioritize and organize multiple concurrent assignments.
• Adaptability and flexibility to learn new things and pick up tasks quickly.
• Willingness to learn and accept feedback.
• Basic understanding of accounting principles.
• Prior work in a project coordinator/assistant role is a plus.
• Extensive experience assisting management in day-to-day operations and project-related administrative tasks.
• Ability to perform effectively under pressure in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
• Capable of performing repetitive tasks with a high level of proficiency and accuracy.
• Experience should demonstrate sound judgment, the ability to multi-task, complete tasks in a timely manner, and work effectively under pressure.
• Experience with data management, accounting, finance, or business is preferred.
Education and Experience
• Bachelor’s degree preferred.
• At least three (3) years of related project administrative experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
• Experience working in the Engineering industry is a plus.

This description is not a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that may be required of the employee and other duties, responsibilities and activities may be assigned or may be changed at any time with or without notice.

The Research and Data Coordinator is responsible for conceptualizing, researching, gathering \& assembling information. Responsible for researching various policies regarding Housing and Infrastructure, providing data and details for media statements, and drafting research documents and recommendations for an effective First Nations decision\-making process related to Housing and Infrastructure for First Nations in Manitoba.

* Conduct research and data and provide supporting information for briefing notes, reports, and other written materials for internal and external audiences.

* Create various statistics, data, spreadsheets, charts, and presentations pertinent to the various projects and research tasks.
* Ability to retrieve information and data through outside sources, such as the “Freedom of Information Act” or the archives.
* Stay current with the various Housing and Infrastructure issues specific to First Nations.
* Provide support with the research and data collection for different areas of housing specific to First Nations.
* Research policy and governance functions of Housing in First Nations.
* Conducted statistical research and prepared draft presentations.
* Basic data analysis and summary preparations.
* Support the success of work plans, tasking, and setting benchmarks by management.
* Draft higher\-level presentations when needed and specific to strategies, discussion papers, and position papers.
* Adhere to office policies and procedures and confidentiality.
* Perform any other related duties as assigned by management.
**Qualifications, Education \& Experience**

* Demonstrates data management skills.
* Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.
* Demonstrates problem\-solving and organization skills.
* Knowledge of First Nation’s policies and political issues in Housing and Infrastructure would be an asset.
* Excellent time management skills.
* Reliable, trustworthy, and dependable.
* Ability to work closely with others, independently or as a member of a multi\-disciplinary team of professionals.
* Ability to follow office procedures, practices, and confidentiality.
* Demonstrates problem\-solving and organizational skills.
* Proficient use of Microsoft Office software, including Word, Excel, and Outlook.
* Adhere to AMC policies and procedures with specific attention to attendance and professional ethics.
* Possess a valid Class 5F Driver’s License, work flexible hours, and travel upon request.

Overview:

The Quality Control Supervisor’s role is to perform and coordinate the quality control/assurance functions in the Precast division i.e. Precast & Hollowcore plants including all processes required to plan and execute our work as well as to oversee/audit the quality of manufactured precast products. The incumbent is responsible for all activities relating to development and maintenance of our precast quality assurance program in all areas of our operations.
• *Responsibilities**:
• *Marketing and Customer Relations**:
- Demonstrates continuous effort to improve operations, decrease turnaround times, streamline work processes, and work cooperatively and jointly to provide quality seamless customer service.
- Establish relationships and network with customer.

- Maintain positive working relationship with precast concrete supplier to ensure that appropriate specifications are written and that sufficient receiving inspections are performed on products ordered and received.
- Develop the knowledge and expertise in the Q/C department.
- Quality interface and networking with other ready mix concrete and precasters, Lafarge companies and outside organizations.
- Provide assistance to marketing and sales department in the planning (estimating stage) of a project that requires specific and/or specialized input.
• *Human Resources**
- Oversee objectives, educate and review performance for all reports in the Q/C department.
- Develop knowledge and expertise in the concrete technology.
- Direct and train the Quality Control Technician team members.
- Works directly with project managers, precast engineers, plant managers and supervisors.
- Promote safety awareness.
• *Planning**
- Manage and direct daily tasks for the Q/C technicians.
- Participate in the planning of any new product development initiative.
- Oversee any specific quality plan in any department that is required to execute a job successfully.
- Schedule regular testing of equipment and materials.
• *Technical/Operations**:
- Supervising Q/C technicians in carrying out testes and checks.
- Review and update of the CSA/PCI/CPCI Quality Manual System and audit of the system.
- Oversee and maintain our testing capability (includes people and equipment).
- Monitoring and ensuring the Quality Assurance program is followed.
- Writes or reviews technical and performance specifications, quality standards, sampling plans, and inspections procedures.
- Reviews receiving inspections of materials, supplies and equipment.
- Reviews certificates of compliance or test reports to determine validity.
- Analyzes product test data and writes evaluation reports.
- Ensuring established polices and regulations related to quality control are followed
- Audit and measurement of compliance.
- Project trouble shooting.
- Write plans and procedures and monitor cost for R&D Projects.
• *Financial**
- Ensure that budget is met
- Review testing invoices.
• *Specific Accountabilities**:
- For participating in the planning of projects with specific reference to quality.
- Ensure compliance with all laws and company Q/C and Q/A guidelines and policies.
- Ensure customer satisfaction with excellent product and service quality.
- Demonstrating leadership with respect to quality and process improvement.
Qualifications:
- EIT or CET designation is required.
- More than 5 years of experience in construction industry. Precast industry experience is an asset.
- Knowledge of industrial and commercial building construction practices.
- Must be able to attain PCI Level I/II within 1-year time.
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
- Good organization, supervisory and planning skills.
- Strong team player with a positive attitude.
- Good working knowledge of cementitious materials as well as concrete properties/characteristics

- Advance science of teaching and learning, teaching and learning research, and the scholarship of teaching and learning (SoTL) across UM by building capacity among faculty/instructors to engage in these types of research.
- Build a teaching and learning research community/network within UM.
- Participate in The Centre’s strategic plan development and ensure goals related to research, evaluation, and quality assurance are realized.

Description

Grow with the best. Join a smart, creative, and inspired team that works to support operational excellence. The Stantec community unites more than 31,000 employees working in over 400 locations across 6 continents. Our Functional Services Teams (FSTs) include Corporate Development, Finance, Human Resources, HSSE, IT, Legal, Marketing/Communications, Practice Services and Real Estate and Procurement. Bringing together individuals with diverse backgrounds, talents, and expertise, our FSTs are vital to making our Company stronger.
Your Opportunity

We have an exciting opportunity for a Project Coordinator to join our Research Services team where you will provide essential support and play a crucial part in the successful execution of various projects and initiatives. Stantec’s Research Services team, as part of the Innovation Office, supports employees by providing resources for research, publication, academic collaboration, and related intellectual property management, enhancing project impact and technical expertise. They also assist with claiming research-related tax credits, offering financial benefits that contribute to Stantec’s growth and innovation.
Your Key Responsibilities
• Fully understand the scope of our Research Services programs, including tax credit programs, eLibrary, and academic collaborations and support the program lead in these areas.
• Communicate effectively with internal team members, leadership, financial and tax managers, consultants, and anyone at Stantec seeking support from Research Services.
• Serve as a general liaison for team coordination and communication.

• Assist the team with invoice processing, collaborate with Stantec’s tax and financial team to issue invoices promptly and follow up on outstanding invoices and monitor and track consultant invoices.
• Process orders and support other team members with expense reports and timecards, if required.
• Provide administrative support to Research Services team members as needed.
• Compile, compose, type, and proofread correspondence and various other documents.
• Prepare forms and reports, ensuring they are understandable, timely, and useful.
• Accumulate, compile, consolidate, and edit data, checking document contents for accuracy.
• Create and edit spreadsheets, letters, memoranda, etc., from drafts and general instructions.
• Schedule meetings and coordinate travel, hotel workspaces, itineraries, and arrangements if required.
• Attend meetings and work cooperatively with all team members to transcribe meeting notes.
• Maintain project team directories, file emails, and communicate changes or process updates to the team both internally and externally.
Qualifications
Your Capabilities and Credentials
• Proficient in MS Office, with advanced skills in MS Excel, Teams, and SharePoint.
• Ability to learn new software systems.
• Experience with Financial/Cost systems (e.g., Oracle) is preferred.
• Possess a “can do” and “will do” attitude, taking charge of any assignment given.
• Strong work ethic and willingness to go the extra mile.
• Must be willing and able to take initiative when needed.
• Experience working in a team environment and understanding the importance of being a team player.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
• Self-motivated with the ability to prioritize and communicate with multiple groups.
• High attention to detail is essential.
• Strong organizational and time management skills.
• Ability to prioritize and organize multiple concurrent assignments.
• Adaptability and flexibility to learn new things and pick up tasks quickly.
• Willingness to learn and accept feedback.
• Basic understanding of accounting principles.
• Prior work in a project coordinator/assistant role is a plus.
• Extensive experience assisting management in day-to-day operations and project-related administrative tasks.
• Ability to perform effectively under pressure in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
• Capable of performing repetitive tasks with a high level of proficiency and accuracy.
• Experience should demonstrate sound judgment, the ability to multi-task, complete tasks in a timely manner, and work effectively under pressure.
• Experience with data management, accounting, finance, or business is preferred.
Education and Experience
• Bachelor’s degree preferred.
• At least three (3) years of related project administrative experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
• Experience working in the Engineering industry is a plus.

This description is not a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that may be required of the employee and other duties, responsibilities and activities may be assigned or may be changed at any time with or without notice.

Overview:

The Quality Control Supervisor’s role is to perform and coordinate the quality control/assurance functions in the Precast division i.e. Precast & Hollowcore plants including all processes required to plan and execute our work as well as to oversee/audit the quality of manufactured precast products. The incumbent is responsible for all activities relating to development and maintenance of our precast quality assurance program in all areas of our operations.
• *Responsibilities**:
• *Marketing and Customer Relations**:
- Demonstrates continuous effort to improve operations, decrease turnaround times, streamline work processes, and work cooperatively and jointly to provide quality seamless customer service.
- Establish relationships and network with customer.

- Maintain positive working relationship with precast concrete supplier to ensure that appropriate specifications are written and that sufficient receiving inspections are performed on products ordered and received.
- Develop the knowledge and expertise in the Q/C department.
- Quality interface and networking with other ready mix concrete and precasters, Lafarge companies and outside organizations.
- Provide assistance to marketing and sales department in the planning (estimating stage) of a project that requires specific and/or specialized input.
• *Human Resources**
- Oversee objectives, educate and review performance for all reports in the Q/C department.
- Develop knowledge and expertise in the concrete technology.
- Direct and train the Quality Control Technician team members.
- Works directly with project managers, precast engineers, plant managers and supervisors.
- Promote safety awareness.
• *Planning**
- Manage and direct daily tasks for the Q/C technicians.
- Participate in the planning of any new product development initiative.
- Oversee any specific quality plan in any department that is required to execute a job successfully.
- Schedule regular testing of equipment and materials.
• *Technical/Operations**:
- Supervising Q/C technicians in carrying out testes and checks.
- Review and update of the CSA/PCI/CPCI Quality Manual System and audit of the system.
- Oversee and maintain our testing capability (includes people and equipment).
- Monitoring and ensuring the Quality Assurance program is followed.
- Writes or reviews technical and performance specifications, quality standards, sampling plans, and inspections procedures.
- Reviews receiving inspections of materials, supplies and equipment.
- Reviews certificates of compliance or test reports to determine validity.
- Analyzes product test data and writes evaluation reports.
- Ensuring established polices and regulations related to quality control are followed
- Audit and measurement of compliance.
- Project trouble shooting.
- Write plans and procedures and monitor cost for R&D Projects.
• *Financial**
- Ensure that budget is met
- Review testing invoices.
• *Specific Accountabilities**:
- For participating in the planning of projects with specific reference to quality.
- Ensure compliance with all laws and company Q/C and Q/A guidelines and policies.
- Ensure customer satisfaction with excellent product and service quality.
- Demonstrating leadership with respect to quality and process improvement.
Qualifications:
- EIT or CET designation is required.
- More than 5 years of experience in construction industry. Precast industry experience is an asset.
- Knowledge of industrial and commercial building construction practices.
- Must be able to attain PCI Level I/II within 1-year time.
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
- Good organization, supervisory and planning skills.
- Strong team player with a positive attitude.
- Good working knowledge of cementitious materials as well as concrete properties/characteristics

Lab Research Assistant
We are seeking a Lab Research Assistant to participate in the short

- and long-term deliverables of the Double Haploid and Seed Quality Analysis Laboratories through the use of cutting-edge research equipment, methodology and materials to support the decision-making process of the Canola Breeding Pipeline, while in compliance with quality and safety standards.
This is a permanent position based out of Winnipeg, Manitoba Smart Park lab location.
• *What you will do**:
Assist in preparation of media, tissue sampling and ploidy analysis.
Receive, sort, clean and scan seed samples
Prepare and analyze samples using Near Infrared Spectroscopy (NIR), Gas Chromatography (GC) and flow cytometry
Maintenance and calibration of laboratory equipment
Maintenance and organization of seed inventory and other research records
Actively participate in process improvement initiatives
Follow all Quality Management System (QMS) and Health Safety and Environment (HSE) procedures and promote implementation within the QA and DH programs
Maintain tidiness & orderliness within the workplace
Participate in task-related document creation and process review for job-related activities
Assist in other projects & performs other duties as required
• *Who you are**:
Degree in the chemical sciences
1/+ years' work experience with NIR and GC analysis
Strong computer software literacy using Microsoft Office suite
Highly motivated, results oriented, with the ability to work with people individually or in a team to gain commitment to achieve those results
Possess strong ability to work accurately and pay attention to detail
Strong organization skills and ability to prioritize daily tasks
Flexible attitude and ability to learn new procedures
Ability to communicate complex ideas in a clear, concise, and actionable manner
Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills
• *What we offer**:
Competitive compensation and rewards package
Collaborative, diverse and inclusive culture
Career development and global opportunities
Work-life flexibility programs such as flex hours, employee discounts, volunteer days, wellness, and other employee offerings

Bayer is committed to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of Inclusion and Diversity. We embrace and encourage our employees' differences and believe that our people are our most valuable asset. The collective sum of individual life experiences, knowledge, innovation, self-expression, unique capabilities that our employees invest in their work represents our culture, reputation, and Bayer's values and purpose.

• *Division**:
Crop Science

go-8bF8Gc9quEGOAcPFAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-1e82aabfa8ebc3b146992b6288ab53c8?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,"Research Assistant, Lab Development for Cultural",University of Winnipeg,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-14,,,,,,,False,,,,,"**This posting will be used to hire 1-3 positions**

Research Assistants are normally students, in a University of Winnipeg undergraduate program, employed to assist with tasks related to research. Work is performed within defined guidelines and under supervision of a more senior researcher or faculty member.
• *Position Overview**:

The Research Assistant will help with researching, developing, and testing new lab-based experiential learning resources for first and second-year courses in Cultural Anthropology, drawing on new and existing collections at the Anthropology Museum. This project is supported by the University of Winnipeg Experiential Learning Fund.
• *Duties**:
- Compile bibliographies and literature reviews for assigned lab topics
- Employee will conduct literature searches, locate pertinent document extracts, and create a literature review for each lab.
- Locate new collections items for purchase by the Anthropology Museum to support lab teaching.
- Employee will search online sales catalogues or directly contact providers to identify purchase options for new resources sought for lab instruction.
- Prepare and format instruction sheets and text panels for use by students.
- Employee will draft object labels, summary text panels, activity instructions, and question sheets for use in labs.
- Assist with pilot labs
- Employee will set up and observe pilot lab activities, debrief participants, and prepare a summary report on student learning.
• *Qualifications**:
- Anthropology major or minor.

- Completion of ANTH-1002 (Introduction to Cultural Anthropology and Linguistics) or ANTH-1005 (Introduction to Cultural Anthropology - Indigenous Focus), and ANTH-2100 (Method and Theory in Cultural Anthropology) is required.
- Completion of or enrollment in in ANTH-2013 (Ethnography of Indigenous Peoples in Canada and the US) is preferred.
- Ability to organize information and communicate effectively in writing.
• *Condition(s) of Employment**:
- **Must be legally entitled to work in Canada.**
The period of work will be from **December 9, 2024 - March 31, 2025 **and the estimated total hours of work will be **40-120 hours**.
• *_ Note_**_: This position is represented by the Public Service Alliance of Canada - Research Capacity Unit._
• *Note**: The work described in this posting will be conducted in-person.",,,,,,,,,laboratory technician,2025-01-27

Research Assistants are normally students, in a University of Winnipeg undergraduate program, employed to assist with tasks related to research. Work is performed within defined guidelines and under supervision of a more senior researcher or faculty member.

The Research Assistant will help with researching, developing, and testing new lab-based experiential learning resources for first and second-year courses in Cultural Anthropology, drawing on new and existing collections at the Anthropology Museum. - Prepare and format instruction sheets and text panels for use by students.
- Employee will draft object labels, summary text panels, activity instructions, and question sheets for use in labs.
- Assist with pilot labs

- Completion of ANTH-1002 (Introduction to Cultural Anthropology and Linguistics) or ANTH-1005 (Introduction to Cultural Anthropology - Indigenous Focus), and ANTH-2100 (Method and Theory in Cultural Anthropology) is required.
- Completion of or enrollment in in ANTH-2013 (Ethnography of Indigenous Peoples in Canada and the US) is preferred.
- Ability to organize information and communicate effectively in writing.
• *Condition(s) of Employment**:
- **Must be legally entitled to work in Canada.**
The period of work will be from **December 9, 2024 - March 31, 2025 **and the estimated total hours of work will be **40-120 hours**.

• *Note**: The work described in this posting will be conducted in-person.",,,,,,,,,research assistant,2025-01-27

• *Posting #24-14-011 (REPOSTED)**

The Manitoba Métis Federation (MMF) is the democratically elected National Government of the Red River Métis, also known as the Manitoba Métis. The Red River Métis are a distinct Indigenous Nation and People, and Canada's Negotiating Partners in Confederation and the Founders of the Province of Manitoba.

The MMF seeks to fill **one full-time Research Program Manager** position within our **Early Learning and Child Care Department **located at 200 Main Street in **Winnipeg, MB**. The Research Program Manager will be required to supervise and administer the conduct of research, analysis, and reporting on a range of Early Learning and Child Care issues with respect to qualitative research.
• *_ Job Duties/Competencies:_**
- Assist with research and analysis on a broad range of Early Childhood issues, identifying their implications as they relate to the adaptation of child care programs and services
- Collaborate with colleagues and stakeholders to collect, synthesize and interpret data using rigorous qualitative and mixed-method approaches
- Facilitate the collection and review of data through the surveys and consultation initiatives
- Report on current issues and priorities important to the MMF through review of materials and development of supporting documentation
- Assist with writing for the Early Learning and Child Care Department
- Manage and organize staff to achieve sector’s goals and project objectives
- Attend seminars and other meetings as they relate to the project(s).
• *_ Skills and Qualifications:_**
- Graduate Degree in Social Science, Social Services, Economic or relevant field, and/or equivalent experience
- Three years’ experience in research/project management
- Experience negotiating and administering contracts is preferred
- Experience in report writing, proposal development, policy analysis and review
- Proficiency in Microsoft Office
- Strong organizational, interpersonal, and time management skills
- Experience working with boards and/or committees is preferred
- Experience working for a not-for-profit organization and Indigenous community is an asset
- Knowledge of Red River Métis culture, MMF programs and services is a definite asset

go-L1TCyMuqorxL44r4AAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-cf62de582d649a85434a1e9493f8d2db?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,"Manager, Data Governance and Architecture",Manitoba Public Insurance,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-14,,,,,,,False,,,,,"Overview:

As the Manager, Data Governance and Architecture you are responsible for the development, delivery and evaluation of evidence-based strategic plans to advance corporate data management objectives. You will oversee the development and administration of MPI’s data architecture assets including conceptual, logical, and physical data models, and contribute to the development of data solutions and the selection of data management and business intelligence technologies.
• *Responsibilities**:
- Foster a high-performance culture that is consistent with corporate vision, values and leading practices.
- Participate in and engage others in decision-making, information sharing, and identifying opportunities for improvement, resolution of client group concerns, and encourage others to do the same.
- Oversee the development of the data governance and the data architecture program and roadmap (annual).
- Lead the creation, maintenance and monitoring of the data governance policies, processes, procedures and playbook(s) for guiding the data management aspects of the Enterprise Data Lake.

- Define and develop enterprise data architecture strategy, framework and standards leveraging advanced data technologies and provide valuable input in the development of governance processes around technology and business aspects of the Enterprise Data Architecture framework.
- Define, implement and provide effective internal independent architecture validation process and other relevant enterprise data governance.

- Guide the identification, research, selection, and alignment of technology solutions which meet business and technical requirements in the areas of data warehousing, business intelligence, data science/big data, database management, and cloud data platforms.
Qualifications:
- Education in Commerce, Computer Science, Information Systems, Analytics or related discipline.
- Industry certification related to data (e.g. DAMA-DMBOK2) is an asset.
- Related experience in data governance, data strategy development and/or data architecture, including three years in a leadership capacity.
- Experience in other data related domains such as data quality, data security, or data management is an asset.
- Strategic planning, analysis and business case development skills and business acumen.
- Read, understand, interpret, examine, and evaluate researched information, evidence, concepts and ideas, and to formulate and defend positions.
- Organizational skill with the ability to navigate and prioritize strategically in an environment with multiple competing priorities, tight deadlines and a degree of risk.
- Expertise in data architecture tools such as SAP Power Designer, IDERA, etc.
- Advance knowledge of data architecture concepts and practices.
Employee Benefits:
• *Health benefits**
We offer a comprehensive health benefits program that includes:
- flexible health, dental and vision plans
- health spending account
- travel health coverage
- other extended health benefits such as ambulance, massage and physiotherapy
• *Financial security**
In an effort to support financial security, we offer:
- registered pension plan
- group, dependent, and optional life insurance coverage
- critical illness insurance
- sick leave to cover short-term disability
- long-term disability
• *Wellness**
We offer programs that focus on how to better achieve a balance between work and personal commitments, as well as maintain a healthy workplace culture. This includes:
- vacation entitlement
- flexible work arrangement for eligible positions
- maternity, parental and adoptive leaves
- bereavement and family responsibility leaves
- employee and family assistance program
- mental-health programming
- lunch-and-learn offerings
- discounted gym memberships and wellness account
• *Diversity and inclusion**

Manitoba Public Insurance believes that diversity and inclusion strengthens us. We consider ourselves to be a barrier-free organization where individual values, beliefs and practices are respected and appreciated for the diversity they bring to our work life.
• *Employee recognition**

It’s important to recognize our employees for their contributions. Not only do we recognize employees as they achieve milestone years in their careers, we also have several outlets for leaders and peers to reward each other for work well done.
• *Professional development**
We want our employees to grow, which is why we offer support in keeping their skills up-to-date. We offer in-house training, professional development and an educational assistance program.
• *Safety and health**

In an effort to encourage a safe and healthy work environment, we offer various safety, health and workplace policies and programs along with technical expertise and assistance to support employee activities in safety and health.",,,,,,,,,data analyst,2025-01-27

- Perform any other related duties as assigned by management.

- Demonstrates data management skills.
- Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.
- Demonstrates problem-solving and organization skills.
- Knowledge of First Nation’s policies and political issues in Housing and Infrastructure would be an asset.
- Excellent time management skills.
- Reliable, trustworthy, and dependable.
- Ability to work closely with others, independently or as a member of a multi-disciplinary team of professionals.
- Ability to follow office procedures, practices, and confidentiality.
- Demonstrates problem-solving and organizational skills.
- Proficient use of Microsoft Office software, including Word, Excel, and Outlook.

go-r9_BX7_1y7y1RO0jAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.bebee.com/job/d869263634023b349a2e3aa26f948aec?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Application Architect – Digital Analytics and Reporting,BQ INTERNATIONAL LTD.,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-11,,,,,,,False,,,,,"Application Architect – Digital Analytics and Reporting
This role is responsible for developing a corporate data analytics strategy that keeps pace with MPI's modernization activities and adoption of cloud technologies.
The strategy will consider the existing legacy infrastructure, changing reporting needs, and the new technologies being adopted.
It will also need to deal with the complex aspects of our information management, decision support, and analytics from user experience and performance, infrastructure, security, and governance.
Key Responsibilities:
• Develop application architectures, frameworks, and strategies to meet business and application requirements.
• Define architecture to be used in web-based projects.
• Identify policies and requirements that drive out a particular solution.
• Analyze and evaluate alternative technology solutions to meet business problems.
• Ensure the integration of all aspects of technology solutions.
• Monitor industry trends to ensure that solutions fit with government and industry directions for technology.
• Analyze functional requirements to identify information, procedures, and decision flows.
• Evaluate existing procedures and methods, identify and document database content, structure, and application sub-systems, and develop data dictionary.
• Define and document interfaces of manual to automated operations within application sub-systems, to external systems, and between new and existing systems.
• Define input/output sources, including a detailed plan for the technical design phase, and obtain approval of the system proposal.
• Identify and document system-specific standards relating to programming, documentation, and testing, covering program libraries, data dictionaries, naming conventions, etc.
• Perform architectural modeling to ensure consistency of the design with existing work.
• Assess the impact of the new requirements on existing web applications.
• Ensure functionalities have been implemented according to specifications.
• Define assumptions and constraints of architecture with regard to physical structure and data collection.
• Develop post-implementation plan for monitoring/tracking architecture stability.
Requirements:
• 7+ years of relevant experience in this role.
• Preferably with a recognized professional certification.
• Leverage the organization's information and infrastructure environment as well as a modern, emerging technology landscape to design a holistic and optimized analytics platform.
• Experience establishing business intelligence technology standards, creating an analytics roadmap, infrastructure, and tools in a hybrid (Cloud and on-premise) environment.
• Setup and organization of Data Warehouse and Data Marts. Experience defining logical data warehouses and working with virtual infrastructure is an asset.
• Analytic processing.
• Predictive Analytics, Big Data, and Data Lakes.
• Adhoc Reporting.
• Static Reporting.
• Working experience planning and setting up Business Intelligence tools: Tableau and PowerBI are required. Working with SAP is beneficial.
• Experience deploying analytics in a Microsoft environment.
• Experienced working with Agile delivery teams.
• Preference will be given to candidates with experience modernizing legacy data analytics and reporting technologies.",,,,,,,,,data analyst,2025-01-27

column1: go-QcmQgO3IM58L_MKhAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-909c4ade402bedf4fe02a1b578bdab2d?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Harm Reduction Coordinator,Ka Ni Kanichihk Inc.,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-15,,,,,,,False,,,,,"**About the Role**

We are seeking a Harm Reduction Coordinator that will be responsible for the White Wolf Speaking program which offers Indigenous-led and culturally-based workshops on sexual health and reproductive justice.

The Coordinator’s responsibilities include the development, implementation and facilitation of culturally-based educational sessions for the Indigenous community, service providers, and partner agencies with the purpose of promoting and enhancing access to information, services, and supports on sexuality and reproductive health and justice.
• *What You Bring**
- You are supportive of Ka Ni Kanichihk’s values and beliefs
- University Degree in a related field and three (3) years’ experience working in the Indigenous community, or equivalent combination of education and experience
- Experience in program development, delivery, and evaluation
- Knowledge of sexuality and reproductive justice issues
- Knowledge and understanding of anti-oppressive frameworks
- Excellent group facilitation, problem-solving, and team-building skills
- Computer literacy in current/relevant software
- Excellent oral and written communication skills
- Highly effective prioritization, multi-tasking, and time management skills
- Knowledge of community resources
- Demonstrated cultural competence and commitment to cultural reclamation
- Knowledge of adult and youth education principles an asset
- Experience working in the field of community health and/or social services
- Demonstrated ability working in harm reduction, trauma informed, anti-racist, and decolonizing environments
- Experience in the provision and maintenance of budgets and finance management
- Demonstrated ability to lead, train, and supervise team members.
• *Benefits**:
- Casual dress
- Dental care
- Extended health care
- RRSP match
- Vision care
Schedule:
- 8 hour shift",,,,,,,,,program coordinator,2025-01-27

go-_4zUsaHTGTKfW22EAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-b0fd3e81745c0bc2737cfff146e4a4d5?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Proposals Coordinator,PCL Construction,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-15,,,,,,,False,,,,,"**The future you want is within reach.**

At PCL, we build the places where life happens and find camaraderie in the process. We're a community of builders committed to building better communities. That's why we're always looking ahead, and not just to the next project or what's next in our industry.
We're also looking at what's next for you and how we can help you build a career you're proud of.
Here's how a Proposals Coordinator for our Winnipeg office contributes to our team:
• *Responsibilities**:
- Complete layout and production of proposal materials with a contemporary style.
- Proof, edit, and reword text to deliver a high-quality, compliant, error-free submission on time.
- Assist with the proposal planning process, including review of client requirements, development of proposal outline and creation of timeline/assignments.
- Assist with developing overall proposal strategy and applies it to the proposal in a manner that is compliant with the client requirements and consistent with corporate objectives/policies/goals.
- Conduct client background research, identifies questions, concerns and potential risks to inform the ‘strategic visioning’ and proposal planning stage of the process.
- Identify interview requirements, coordinates the presentation resources, and assists the proposal team in preparation of presentations and interviews.
- Schedule, coordinate, and take a lead role in the proposal strategy and planning sessions.
- Develop and maintain strong stakeholder relationships.
- Other duties as required.
• *Qualifications**:
- Post-secondary degree or diploma in marketing, communications, journalism, or equivalent experience is required.
- 3 years of experience as a proposal coordinator or in a related role (communications, marketing, visual communications).
- Strong project management, organizational, and time management skills to effectively establish the priority and scheduling of work tasks.
- Strong verbal, written, and visual communication skills. Ability to produce grammatically sound written communication with a customer focus.
- Strong working knowledge of proposal fundamentals and best practices
- Strong ability to collaborate on and facilitate a team to a positive result.
- Proficient knowledge of Microsoft Office, Adobe Creative Cloud, and other relevant marketing software systems.

PCL is an innovative, employee-owned company comprised of people who find passion in their profession and take pride in doing great work every day. Our work powers the infrastructure and utilities that are essential to daily life and our projects are the scene of vacations, careers, education and healing. We are consistently ranked among the best companies to work for because we are committed to supporting and developing our teams.

The PCL Companies celebrate diversity and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating equitable opportunities and an inclusive environment for all employees and applicants. We make employment-related decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability or veteran status.

PCL combines numerous pay and benefit strategies to provide a comprehensive and competitive total rewards package. Any salary range displayed by a job board is an estimate. Your salary, which considers your unique qualifications and experience, is just one component of the robust total rewards you'll enjoy at PCL. This may include an employee share purchase offering, discretionary annual performance bonus, comprehensive benefits and wellness programs, retirement plan plus matching, and career development programs.
Together, we can build success and a better future. Let’s get started
• *Employee Status**:Regular Full-Time
• *Company**:PCL Constructors Canada Inc.
• *Primary Location**:Winnipeg, Manitoba
• *Job**:Proposals Coordinator
• *Requisition**: 3445",,,,,,,,,program coordinator,2025-01-27
