gd-1009615505849,glassdoor,https://www.glassdoor.ca/job-listing/j?jl=1009615505849,,Project Manager,MOBIA Technology Innovations,Winnipeg,2025-01-29,,direct_data,yearly,70000.0,70000.0,CAD,False,,,organic,,"**Location:** Remote with Occasional Travel to Northwest Territories
About MOBIA

MOBIA Technology Innovations is a Canadian\-owned business and systems integrator with over 37 years of experience. We serve our clients and the Canadian market through five specialized business units: Broadband and Wireless Services, Managed Services, Hybrid Infrastructure Solutions, Cybersecurity, and Digital Transformation Services.
Our long\-standing relationships with industry\-leading technology partners enable us to deliver innovative solutions that drive positive business outcomes for our clients.
The Opportunity

MOBIA is currently recruiting a Project Manager to join our team remotely. This role is dynamic for a driven professional with strong leadership skills and a customer\-focused approach. You will ensure the successful execution of projects, delivering consistent, on\-time results of the highest quality.
**As a Project Manager, you will play a key role in:**
* Managing customer satisfaction.
* Overseeing project budgets, resource allocation, and vendor relationships.
* Planning, monitoring, and documenting all project phases.
* Delivering results using a traditional waterfall project management approach, ideal for telecom\-related projects.
This position emphasizes resource, task, budget/material, and vendor management. A technical aptitude and background in the Telco Voice/ISP/Broadband network space will be essential to your success.
Key Responsibilities
* Manage a portfolio of telecom technical projects, ranging from small\-scale initiatives to large, complex builds or commissioning projects.
* Develop and maintain project plans, including scope statements, delivery schedules, resource allocation, communication plans, goals, milestones, and deadlines.
* Track project stages, mitigate risks, and escalate roadblocks as necessary.
* Coordinate and oversee all tasks required to initiate, execute, and close projects.
* Provide detailed project documentation, reporting, and follow\-up for internal and external stakeholders.
* Facilitate regular customer meetings and maintain consistent communication with all team members, clients, and stakeholders.
* Ensure completed projects meet specifications and are thoroughly documented.
* Monitor project budgets, track material costs, and ensure compliance with invoice and financial forecasting requirements.
Skills and Qualifications
* A Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Science, or Engineering.
* Minimum of 5 years experience in Project Management, Project Coordination, or Implementation Management.
* Leadership experience and team coaching skills are an asset.
* Experience managing projects using Waterfall methodology
* Technical aptitude in the telecom industry are definite assets
* Proven ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, including schedules and budgets.
* Exceptional communication, relationship\-building, and organizational skills to excel in a fast\-paced environment.
* Proficiency in the MS Office suite and the ability to quickly learn new software.
* Ability to travel as required.
* PMP certification is an asset.
* Bilingualism in French and English is an asset.
Why MOBIA?
At MOBIA, we empower businesses through digital transformation and thought leadership. Our innovative approach has earned us recognition, including:
* Canada’s Best Managed Companies 2023 – Deloitte
* Canada Regional Partner of the Year 2023 – Arctic Wolf
* Canada’s Top Growing Companies 2022 – The Globe and Mail
* Canada’s Top 10 Cyber Security Solutions Providers 2022 – The Cyber Security Review
What We Offer
We value the well\-being and professional growth of our team, providing:
* Comprehensive health and dental insurance.
* Employee Assistance Program.
* RRSP/TFSA contribution programs.
* Professional development opportunities.
* Regular company events fostering fun and community engagement.
Diversity and Inclusion
MOBIA is an Equal Opportunity Employer, celebrating diversity and fostering an inclusive environment for all employees.
How to Apply

We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Please note: MOBIA does not accept unsolicited resumes from third\-party vendors or recruitment agencies.",,https://www.glassdoor.ca/Overview/W-EI_IE835877.htm,https://media.glassdoor.com/sql/835877/mobia-technology-innovations-squarelogo-1461073842802.png,,,,,,project manager,2025-01-29
gd-1009614506398,glassdoor,https://www.glassdoor.ca/job-listing/j?jl=1009614506398,,Project Manager - Commissioning,BGIS,Winnipeg,2025-01-29,,,,,,,False,,,organic,,"**Who We Are**

BGIS is a leading provider of customized facility management and real estate services. With our combined team of over 6, 500 globally, we relentlessly focus on enabling innovation through the services we deliver, while actively looking for new opportunities that will enable innovation for our clients’ businesses. Globally, we manage over 320 million square feet of client portfolios across 30,000\+ locations in North America, Europe, Middle East, Australia and Asia. Further information is available at www.bgis.com
**SUMMARY**

The **Commissioning Oversight Specialist** provides technical review and recommendations related to design, specifications, construction, and turnover of projects to ensure project quality and the effective integration into building operations and maintenance. The Commissioning Oversight Specialist works with technical team members, third party consultants, and contractors.
**KEY DUTIES \& RESPONSIBILITIES**
**Deliverables**
* Oversee the development, planning and implementation of the commissioning oversight process within project scope, schedule, budget and BGIS/Client procedural requirements.

* As a specialist, provide oversight on basis of design , specifications and drawings including commissioning specifications, contractor engagement, systems start\-up \& performance verification testing coordination, operations, and maintenance documentation.
**Team Support**

* Communicates with Commissioning Oversight Manager, Project Managers, Property Managers, BGIS technical personnel, 3rd party commissioning agents, consultants, and other resources to meet the commissioning oversight deliverables for a project.
* Works as a team to ensure continuous improvement of the commissioning oversight delivery process.
* Provides ongoing operational support to the property team, including building assessments and capital planning support.
* Supports facility operations teams with re\-commissioning and retro commissioning activities.
* Effectively communicates with both internal and external clients
* Skilled in technical report writing.
* Other duties as assigned
**KNOWLEDGE \& SKILLS**
* University or college degree in related field, electrical, mechanical, building systems engineering or building envelope is preferred.
* Experience in building operations.
* Experience in commissioning related activities.
* Familiar with National and Provincial building codes and standards
* Familiar with modern practices and typical building equipment/systems and site services.
* Strong understanding of the construction sector.
* Strong analytical and problem\-solving skills
* Ability to develop, analyze and understand complex processes
* Sound judgement skills based on observation of objective evidence
* Ability to perform with minimum direct supervision
* Ability to communicate in French and English is an asset
**Licenses and/or Professional Accreditation**
* Certified Commissioning Professional from BCxA, ASHRAE or equivalent certification or be able to apply to obtain such certification
* Member of Professional Engineers Association is an asset
* Engineering Technician or College diploma in Engineering technology or any other equivalent designation is an asset
* Valid Driver’s License

At BGIS we believe that diversity and inclusion is a key business driver, such that we never lose sight of its importance as it is woven into the fabric of our organization. We are committed to maintaining a barrier\-free recruitment process by providing equal employment opportunities through recruiting and retention of individuals of all backgrounds. We recognize that promoting diversity is an essential component of our continuing pursuit for organizational success!

BGIS is an equal opportunity employer and we welcome you to apply for a position with us! If you require accommodation during the recruitment process, please contact us at askHR . Upon request for accommodation, we will consult with the applicant in question and provide, or arrange for the provision of, a suitable accommodation in a manner that takes into account the applicant’s accessibility needs due to disability.",,https://www.glassdoor.ca/Overview/W-EI_IE1098670.htm,https://media.glassdoor.com/sql/1098670/bgis-squareLogo-1622038549271.png,,,,,,project manager,2025-01-29

Are you passionate about delivering IT solutions? Do you have the technical expertise and leadership skills to drive complex projects to success? We want to hear from you if you're ready to take the lead in delivering exceptional results with a dynamic team.
Are you a great communicator? Can you speak in a language people can easily understand and quickly make personal connections to grow relationships?
Do you enjoy a collaborative, supportive team environment? Do you have a passion for helping team members and clients solve problems?
Are you detail\-orientated and able to run and track multiple tasks simultaneously?
I know that is a lot of questions, but is your answer YES to all of them? Then we have the career for you if you have these must\-haves:
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, both written and verbal (in English).
* Client service expertise to deliver legendary service the HUB way.
* Exceptional ability to prioritize and execute tasks under pressure.
* University degree or college diploma in a related field or equivalent practical experience.
* At least five years of delivering IT infrastructure solutions (Microsoft Server, Networking, etc.).
* At least two years of project management experience.
If everything is good, then apply for this position. If you want to go “over the top,” include a link to a quick, less than 3\-minute personal introduction video.
Here is the traditional job posting if you are interested in reading it:
**Job Description**
**Title:** IT Project Manager
**Reports To:** Vice President of Operations
**Summary of Position:**

The IT Project Manager oversees projects and manages a small team, emphasizing strong communication and interpersonal skills. This role involves setting project objectives, planning technical delivery, fostering a positive team environment, and ensuring quality and customer satisfaction.
**Accountabilities:**
* Communicate effectively with project teams and stakeholders.
* Mentor and lead project team members.
* Foster key business relationships with clients and third\-party vendors.
* Lead all project phases from initiation to completion.
* Define and manage project scope, goals, budget and outcomes with leadership and stakeholders.
* Conduct project retrospectives to identify successful practices and areas for improvement.
* Adherence and understanding of HUB’s defined processes and help develop new ones.
* Maintaining a commitment to business quality and delivering legendary client service.
* Resolving client inquiries expeditiously and professionally.
* Efficient communication skills, in both written and verbal forms, to keep clients and management aware of work status, progress, and problem\-resolution
* Ensure accurate data entry in HUB’s Professional Service Automation software.
* Maintain a clean and safe work environment.
* Adhere to HUB’s timekeeping and attendance policies.
* Work at HUB’s office during regular business hours, Monday to Friday from 8:30 am to 5:00 pm CST except holidays.
* Uphold HUB’s Employee Code of Conduct.
**Qualifications:**
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, both written and verbal, in English.
* Client service expertise is essential.
* Exceptional ability to prioritize and execute tasks under pressure.
* At least five years of delivering IT infrastructure solutions (Microsoft Server, Networking, etc).
* University degree or college diploma in a related field or equivalent practical experience.
* At least two years of direct project management experience.
* PMI certifications are highly regarded.
* Microsoft Certifications (e.g. MCSE) are preferred.
* Valid Manitoba Class 5F Driver’s License and access to a vehicle for company use.
* Legal entitlement to work in Canada.
**Performance Evaluation:**
Performance evaluations will be conducted at least every 90 days, and potential adjustments to salary or compensation will be assessed by the company at its discretion.
**About Us:**
HUB began in 1991 because our CEO, Troy McLennan, realized how much business owners struggled to understand and use IT to their advantage. Instead, it was stressful and complicated.
As a business owner, Troy experienced sleepless nights, worrying about technology, frustrated about unresolved issues, and stressed about investing in tech but not getting value from it.

We are a team of innovative information technology experts committed to removing your IT burden and communicating with you in a language you can understand. Our motto is: Technology is complicated. It is hard for you to keep up, and that is frustrating. HUB Technology Solutions makes technology simple and stress\-free.

If you want to demonstrate your attention to detail, add the word ""kaizen"" anywhere in our cover letter or resume.",,https://www.glassdoor.ca/Overview/W-EI_IE3475655.htm,,,,,,,project manager,2025-01-29

Having over 50 years in the industry, we offer clients an abundance of knowledge and expertise in a variety of landscaping options. From paving stone and concrete installation, to retaining walls, to softscaping – J\&D Penner does it all. We are now seeking an eager and detail\-oriented individual to join our team in a Project Manager \& Estimator role in our Residential Department. This would include being that first contact to our Residential clients, creating designs and estimating quotes, overseeing the execution of various types of landscape construction projects so that they are installed within a given time and budget, and most importantly ensuring workmanship is to our standards for customer satisfaction, while maintaining safety and compliance with all relevant regulations. This is a hybrid role between office and project sites, proper time management is critical.
**Skills Required:**
* 3\+ years of experience in landscape construction.
* Strong leadership, communication, and organizational skills. Knowledge of landscape design, construction methods, and materials.
* Expertise in landscape construction, including hardscaping (pavers, retaining walls, water features), softscaping, and site grading.
**Responsibilities:**
* Meet with potential clients in a friendly and efficient manner, gathering required information in order to provide project specific quotes and rough design template.
* Coordinate with office, crew and clients, to ensure that the projects are completed to customer specifications.

* Supervise and provide direction to landscaping crews. Assign tasks, monitor performance, and provide support to ensure the team works efficiently and adheres to project timelines. This may include hands on support on the construction site. Ensure that work is being performed according to specifications, safety standards, and industry best practices. Enforce safety protocols and ensure that all team members follow proper safety procedures, including the use of personal protective equipment (PPE) and safe handling of tools and materials.

* Work with office to create project tracking and budget forms to ensure that projects are completed within financial constraints and products ordered correctly. As well as ensuring that any necessary permits are collected if applicable.

* Inspect work sites regularly to ensure that the quality of work is consistent with design plans and safety regulations. Perform final inspections to ensure the completed project meets all requirements.
*This is a season position, our season typically begins in March and ends mid to late November.*

* Extended health care

* Store discount
* Vision care
Schedule:
* Monday to Friday
* Overtime
Experience:

go-azaYtLkNgJk6WOe3AAAAAA==,google,https://ca.bebee.com/job/46fd49d810b7e2e8d6c0c1f9dfdd8504?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Telecommunications Product Lifecycle Manager,Valley Fiber Ltd,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-18,,,,,,,False,,,,,"Job Title: Product Manager – Telecommunications Lifecycle Management
Overview:

Valley Fiber Ltd. is a leading provider of telecommunications services, and we're seeking an experienced Product Manager to lead our product lifecycle management efforts. This role involves driving product strategy, innovation, and ensuring seamless execution of product changes that enhance customer experience and align with business goals.
Key Responsibilities:

1. Lead the end-to-end management of products, from concept through to launch, growth, maturity, and eventual phase-out. Ensure that product performance is continually assessed and optimized based on customer feedback and market trends.

2. Define and develop long-term product strategies that align with business objectives and customer needs. Identify opportunities for innovation, product enhancement, and differentiation in the market.

3. Map the customer journey to better understand touchpoints and areas where product experience can be improved. Work closely with cross-functional teams to enhance each stage of the journey and ensure product offerings are aligned with customer expectations.

4. Lead the creation and execution of go-to-market plans for new product features, enhancements, or changes. Coordinate with Sales, Marketing, and Customer Care teams to ensure smooth product launches and successful integration into the existing customer base.

5. Identify areas for product improvement, leveraging customer data, analytics, and industry trends. Drive continuous product optimization to enhance performance, customer satisfaction, and competitive positioning.

6. Conduct thorough market research and competitive analysis to inform product strategy. Understand industry trends, competitor offerings, and customer preferences to make informed decisions about product direction.

7. Act as the primary liaison between Product, Sales, Marketing, and Customer Care teams to ensure alignment on product changes, customer impact, and go-to-market plans. Work closely with engineering and operations to ensure product changes are implemented smoothly and effectively.

8. Develop and manage communication plans for product changes that impact customers. Ensure all stakeholders are informed and prepared to support the changes, and that customers are clearly informed of product updates in a timely and customer-centric manner.
Requirements:
• Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, Product Management, or related field
column2: MBA preferred

Winnipeg, Manitoba",WSP,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-17,contract,,,,,,True,,,,,"WSP USA is seeking an Environmental Remediation Project Manager in Winnipeg, Manitoba. This role involves collaborating with a team of specialists to manage contaminated site closures, preparing safety and emergency plans, and overseeing project accounting and reporting. Candidates should have a degree in engineering or earth sciences and at least 5 years of relevant experience. WSP offers flexible work options, competitive pay, and a supportive corporate culture focused on sustainable development and community enhancement.
The Opportunity:

We are a global leader in the Earth and Environment sector, Globally headquartered in Montreal, where it all began, we proudly serve communities from coast to coast and beyond. With Golder now part of our WSP team, we have over 14,000 multidisciplinary professionals worldwide collaborating daily to protect and conserve natural landscapes, create firm foundations for communities to stand on, and champion sustainable development to combat climate change.

Our team is growing, and as a result we're adding a Remediation Project Manager to our group. You will be responsible for driving contaminated downstream sites to closure through your work with a close-knit team of engineering specialists, professionals, and technical staff.
Why WSP?

• Our Flexible Work Policy – we recognize the importance of balance in our lives and encourage you to prioritize the balance in yours. We will support you on and off the job so you can be fully present in both your work and home lives.
• A Canadian success story - we're proud to wear the red and white of this beautiful country and show the world what Canada has to offer,
• Enhance the world around you - from the environment to the highways, to the buildings and the terrain, WSP is the fabric of Canada.
• Outstanding career opportunities - we're growing and pushing ourselves every day to be greater than yesterday - we're open to your ideas and trying new things.
• A phenomenal collaborative culture and a workforce filled with genuinely good people who are doing humbly important work. Come find out for yourself what it's like to be a part of our journey.

We offer attractive pay, a great corporate culture, comprehensive and employee-focused benefits including virtual healthcare and a wellness platform as well as great savings programs, and a clear vision for the future. We offer flexible work options including remote work.
# WeAreWSP
What will you do at WSP
• You participate in a team environment, work closely with Project Coordinators, other Project Managers, Senior Project Directors/Technical Leads and Field Technicians/Scientists/Engineers
• You prepare Health and Safety plans and Emergency response plans
• You prepare proposals and cost estimates, schedule field staff and subcontractors, compile data for, and write, reports including preparing conclusions and recommendations
• You are responsible for project accounting, tracking and reporting requirements to the terms of reference under WSP’s Master Services Agreements
• You train junior staff in environmental practices and conduct site visits to ensure safety and technical requirements are meeting our high standards.

• You interface with clients to ensure needs are met and projects/proposals are moving forward - Work with other members of the team to ensure provision of the support necessary for completion of projects

• You work with and provide support to other members of the Remediation Program Management Group in sharing health and safety, project management, project completion and client service responsibilities
What you bring to WSP
• University degree or college diploma in engineering or natural/earth sciences
• Minimum 5 years of experience in contaminated site assessments and downstream experience is considered an asset
• Sound understanding of the need for health and safety procedures in the workplace/Possess a safety conscious attitude
• Strong field experience is considered an asset
• Understanding of the Alberta, Saskatchewan and Manitoba Environmental regulations
• Professional designation is preferred
WSP is one of the world's leading professional services firms. Our purpose is to future proof our cities and environments.

We have over 65,000 team members across the globe. In Canada, our 12,000+ people are involved in everything from environmental remediation to urban planning, from engineering iconic buildings to designing sustainable transportation networks, from finding new ways to extract essential resources to developing renewable power sources for the future.
At WSP :
• We value our people and our reputation
• We are locally dedicated with international scale
• We are future focused and challenge the status quo
• We foster collaboration in everything we do
• We have an empowering culture and hold ourselves accountable
Please Note:

Health and Safety is a core paramount value of WSP. Given the importance of keeping one another safe it is expected that you comply with our Health, Safety & Environment (HSE) policy at all times as well as client HSE policies when working at client locations.

Offers of employment for safety-sensitive positions involving fieldwork are contingent upon candidates being able to perform key physical tasks of the job as described in the job posting and interview. This may include the ability to work in a variety of environmental conditions, such as remote or isolated areas, working alone, and in inclement weather (within safe and reasonable limits).
WSP welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
WSP is committed to the principles of employment equity. Only the candidates selected will be contacted.
WSP does not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies. For more information please READ THE FULL POLICY. (https://www.wsp.com/en-CA/careers/notice-to-staffing-agencies)
Apply Now
To help us track our recruitment effort, please indicate in your cover/motivation letter where (vacanciesincanada.ca) you saw this job posting.",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-01-29

University degree or college diploma in a related field or equivalent practical experience.
At least two years of direct project management experience.
PMI certifications are highly regarded.
Microsoft Certifications (e.g. MCSE) are preferred.
Valid Manitoba Class 5F Drivers License and access to a vehicle for company use.
Legal entitlement to work in Canada.
Performance Evaluation:
Performance evaluations will be conducted at least every 90 days, and potential adjustments to salary or compensation will be assessed by the company at its discretion.
About Us:
HUB began in 1991 because our CEO, Troy McLennan, realized how much business owners struggled to understand and use IT to their advantage. Instead, it was stressful and complicated.
As a business owner, Troy experienced sleepless nights, worrying about technology, frustrated about unresolved issues, and stressed about investing in tech but not getting value from it.

We are a team of innovative information technology experts committed to removing your IT burden and communicating with you in a language you can understand. Our motto is: Technology is complicated. It is hard for you to keep up, and that is frustrating. HUB Technology Solutions makes technology simple and stress-free.
If you want to demonstrate your attention to detail, add the word ""kaizen"" anywhere in our cover letter or resume.",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-01-29

go-LhgiwUdYUiuxbBE5AAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-469dbc411398c4018305e493ce0402c7?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Facilities Manager,Main Street Project,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-16,contract,,,,,,False,,,,,"**TITLE**: Manager, Facilities
• *LOCATION**: 661 Main
• *REPORTS TO**: Executive Director
• *DIRECT REPORTS**: Maintenance Workers, Green Team Members
• *STARTING SALARY**:$60,000
• *HOURS**: Full-time

Reporting to the Finance Director, the Facilities Maintenance Manager will be responsible for ensuring that MSP facilities are operated and maintained in a safe, efficient and effective manner. Managing supplies, cleaning and staff. This position will have a lead role in project management of structural capital projects (new and existing buildings).This position works collaboratively with internal stakeholders, trade / construction professionals.
• *KEY RESULT AREAS**
• *Daily Maintenance Services**

Lead and supervise delivery of highly efficient and effective daily maintenance services for MSP buildings. Fully understand the operation, features, strengths, and shortcomings of existing facilities.

Make recommendations that will increase ease of use for MSP staff and clients. Develop metrics and key performance indicators for maintenance services. Work cooperatively to ensure cohesive and consistent customer service. Manage annual operating budget for facility repairs and maintenance.
• *Agency-Wide Maintenance Plan**

Lead in development of a proactive maintenance plan that describes current conditions of MSP buildings and facilities. The plan shall make recommendations for each building and its individual building systems with respect to projected remaining service life and estimated costs to repair, renovate, or replace. Keep current and resulting plan to keep short term, mid-range, and long-range recommendations with respect to maintenance efforts and corresponding annual expenditures required to maintain MSP facilities at a high level.
• *Facilities Management**
Be a champion for the development within MSP of a detailed facilities management database of MSP owned/operated buildings. The database shall track size and detailed condition within each building.
These databases shall be maintained current at all times. Database will provide a variety of facilities space utilization and conditions reports to the Finance Director.
• *Dashboards and Benchmarking**
Create and routinely provide reports that measure and monitor the maintenance activities and costs.

Track maintenance and facility improvement projects by type and regularly report progress on schedules, costs, scope etc. Make recommendations for continual improvement. Be active in professional organizations to learn of new best practices.
• *DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**
The Manager is responsible for all functional characteristics of MSP buildings considering health and safety features, such as emergency procedures and security

With offices throughout North America, our passionate and knowledgeable teams deliver projects that enable communities to thrive and people to live, work, move and grow in a rapidly changing world. With over nine decades of experience, Graham has the resources, capacity and expertise to undertake projects of every scope, scale and complexity. Join our team to deliver a better tomorrow.

We are seeking top-tier talent to join our Buildings division and deliver innovative projects in the healthcare, education, hospitality, recreational, entertainment, retail, commercial office, mixed-use, multi-family residential and light industrial sectors. As a member of this collaborative team, you can expect a safe, diverse and inclusive environment, and on-going learning and career development opportunities.
• *About The Role**

Reporting to the Estimating Manager, you will support and lead a variety of project pursuits within our Winnipeg Buildings division with values often up to $50m. • *As an Estimator at Graham, you will**:
- Determine and create the project scope of work to allow for subcontractor assistance

- Complete estimate quantification and draft costing of labor, equipment, and material

- Analyze design criteria and assist in recommending best options based on cost, engineering quality, and availability of materials

- Lead a small team of support estimators and operational staff, assisting with the planning of their time and overseeing delegation and quality of work
- Build upon and maintain relationships with clients, consultants, subcontractors, suppliers, and internal stakeholders that reflect and support Graham core values
• *Qualifications/ Experience**:
- Completion of a Construction related Degree or Diploma training program
- 5+ years of construction-related experience, including a combination of field and estimating experience, is an asset
- Proficiency in the use of OnScreen Takeoff, Bluebeam, Primavera, InEight, MS Excel and BIM modelling is an asset

Graham is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and employment selection decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. Graham does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by country, regional or local law.

go-CZ3yrlwDTdHPkkdyAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-proposal-writer-at-colliers-project-leaders-canada-4099649635?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Senior Proposal Writer,Colliers Project Leaders | Canada,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-15,,,,,,,False,,,,,"Overview

At Colliers Project Leaders, we de liver capital project solutions to fulfill our clients’ needs across the built environment. The work we do makes a difference in communities and for the people who live there. We have a passion for it.

Our commitment to realizing our clients' vision inspires us to look beyond the immediate – to the possibilities of what we can achieve together. We are 18,000 projects and counting – improving lives and helping shape the growth of sustainable, progressive and inclusive communities.
Your role
Join our team as a Senior Proposal Writer with our Proposals Team!

As the Senior Proposal Writer, you are responsible for telling the story of how we can help our clients meet their real property needs. You lead the timely delivery of proposals for various internal teams, writing, editing, coordinating, and formatting content into clear submissions that are responsive to the client’s requirements.

Using your organizational and communication skills, you manage the many moving parts of a submission, by working effectively with a wide range of people, developing strong working relationships with your teams as you do so.
Responsibilities
• Lead the development of professional, high-quality, compelling proposals that effectively educate and inspire action on the part of customers and prospects

• Strategically manage the proposal response from receipt of RFP to the delivery of the final product, including writing content and editing submissions to ensure the proposal is accurate, concise, and effective
• Define and manage the proposal response plan, schedule, and internal communications associated with the proposal development including follow-up with the contributors
• Identify and voice concerns associated with the proposal preparation process and response, as related to issues of compliance and risk
• Actively participate in and lead proposal strategy meetings, researching internal and external information, and distilling into win strategies to be executed in your proposal response
• Participate in trend analysis, proposal debriefings and other similar opportunities to ensure continuous quality improvement and to identify enhancements for proposal content and process
• Support collaboration across the Proposal Team, through updates to our proposal systems and databases of content
Qualifications

• Minimum of 5 years of experience in in reading and responding to Request for Proposal (RFP) documents and developing proposal / bid submissions that respond to their requirements, ideally in the Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC) and/or the professional services industries
• A post-secondary education in Communications, Marketing, English, Writing, Journalism or equivalent field of study
• Advanced working knowledge of MS Office products with strong Word proficiency
• Exceptional business writing, editing, and proofreading skills
• Working knowledge of Adobe Creative Suites software, in particular InDesign, is a strong asset.
Approximate Base Salary Range for Role: $80,000 CAD to $95,000 CAD.

Base Salary pay ranges are determined by role, level, and location and reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire base salaries for the position. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Annual bonus opportunities are in addition to base salary.

Don’t have every single qualification? We know that some people are less likely to apply for a job unless they are a perfect match. At Colliers Project Leaders, we’re not looking for “perfect matches.” We’re looking to welcome people to our diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. So, if you’re excited about this role but don’t have every single qualification, we encourage you to apply anyway. Whether it’s this role or another one, you may be just the right candidate.
What You Can Expect
• An opportunity to truly impact our communities
• A flexible work environment
• A comprehensive onboarding experience
• Significant professional development, training, and a mentorship program
• A paid volunteer day
• An environment where people feel welcome, heard and included, regardless of their differences
• And much more!
Join our team of difference-makers and help shape the growth of dynamic communities.
Disclaimer

Colliers Project Leaders is part of Colliers (NASDAQ, TSX: CIGI), a leading diversified professional services and investment management company, with more than 17,000 professionals operating in 63 countries.
Colliers Project Leaders has suspended our COVID-19 vaccination requirement. In circumstances where our clients have a different COVID-19 vaccination policy, the Clients’ requirements will supersede.

Colliers Project Leaders is an equal opportunity employer and celebrates diversity in its workforce. Colliers encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants' disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. If you require a disability-related accommodation to participate in the recruitment process, please advise the assigned Talent Acquisition Business Partner.
Colliers Project Leaders standard recruitment process requires applicants to be subjected to formal background and reference checks prior to their hiring.",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-01-29

go-wCt_g-dIf-HXygFcAAAAAA==,google,"https://www.ziprecruiter.com/c/Brookfield-Global-Integrated-Solutions-(BGIS)/Job/Project-Manager-Commissioning/-in-Winnipeg,MB?jid=01143cef9ce1c2ca&utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic",,Project Manager - Commissioning,Brookfield Global Integrated Solutions (BGIS),"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-14,contract,,,,,,False,,,,,"Who We Are

BGIS is a leading provider of customized facility management and real estate services. With our combined team of over 6, 500 globally, we relentlessly focus on enabling innovation through the services we deliver, while actively looking for new opportunities that will enable innovation for our clients' businesses. Globally, we manage over 320 million square feet of client portfolios across 30,000+ locations in North America, Europe, Middle East, Australia and Asia. Further information is available at www.bgis.com
SUMMARY

The Commissioning Oversight Specialist provides technical review and recommendations related to design, specifications, construction, and turnover of projects to ensure project quality and the effective integration into building operations and maintenance. The Commissioning Oversight Specialist works with technical team members, third party consultants, and contractors.
KEY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Deliverables
• Oversee the development, planning and implementation of the commissioning oversight process within project scope, schedule, budget and BGIS/Client procedural requirements.

• As a specialist, provide oversight on basis of design , specifications and drawings including commissioning specifications, contractor engagement, systems start-up & performance verification testing coordination, operations, and maintenance documentation.
Team Support

• Communicates with Commissioning Oversight Manager, Project Managers, Property Managers, BGIS technical personnel, 3rd party commissioning agents, consultants, and other resources to meet the commissioning oversight deliverables for a project.
• Works as a team to ensure continuous improvement of the commissioning oversight delivery process.
• Provides ongoing operational support to the property team, including building assessments and capital planning support.
• Supports facility operations teams with re-commissioning and retro commissioning activities.
• Effectively communicates with both internal and external clients
• Skilled in technical report writing.
• Other duties as assigned
KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS
• University or college degree in related field, electrical, mechanical, building systems engineering or building envelope is preferred.
• Experience in building operations.
• Experience in commissioning related activities.
• Familiar with National and Provincial building codes and standards
• Familiar with modern practices and typical building equipment/systems and site services.
• Strong understanding of the construction sector.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
• Ability to develop, analyze and understand complex processes
• Sound judgement skills based on observation of objective evidence
• Ability to perform with minimum direct supervision
• Ability to communicate in French and English is an asset
Licenses and/or Professional Accreditation
• Certified Commissioning Professional from BCxA, ASHRAE or equivalent certification or be able to apply to obtain such certification
• Member of Professional Engineers Association is an asset
• Engineering Technician or College diploma in Engineering technology or any other equivalent designation is an asset
• Valid Driver's License

At BGIS we believe that diversity and inclusion is a key business driver, such that we never lose sight of its importance as it is woven into the fabric of our organization. We are committed to maintaining a barrier-free recruitment process by providing equal employment opportunities through recruiting and retention of individuals of all backgrounds. We recognize that promoting diversity is an essential component of our continuing pursuit for organizational success!

BGIS is an equal opportunity employer and we welcome you to apply for a position with us! If you require accommodation during the recruitment process, please contact us at askHR. Upon request for accommodation, we will consult with the applicant in question and provide, or arrange for the provision of, a suitable accommodation in a manner that takes into account the applicant's accessibility needs due to disability.",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-01-29

go-85kEaAtksQRcdLTAAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-b4d22119783b527c3ea33898e7736e71?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Restoration Project Manager,"Paul Davis Winnipeg, MB","Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-14,,,,,,,True,,,,,"**About us**

Across North America, Paul Davis is helping families and businesses repair their properties and pick up the pieces following an emergency. We use specially designed technology and job management processes to achieve this. And we do it with compassion, integrity and the utmost level of professionalism.
• *Position**: Restoration Project Manager
• *Reports To**:General Manager
• *General Description**

As a Project Manager, you will manage the renovation, as well as control and communicate the budget effectively. This means you will spend a good deal of time in the field to see your projects get completed properly. You will act as a liaison between the Insurance Company and the Property Owner/Manager, managing the claim from start to finish, ensuring each project runs smoothly. This position requires an individual who is organized and committed to being successful. Strong leadership and people management skills are a must as is the ability to communicate effectively with both clients and management.

Due to the nature of our work and the demands of our clients, flexible working hours are required though a typical work week is Monday-Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. You will also be required to participate in the weekly On-Call Rotation.
• *Nature & Scope**
Performs a variety of in duties including:
- Accept claims directly from insurance adjusters and brokers
- Perform site inspections, assess damages, accurately measure and sketch areas, take photos and upload to Encircle software, and ensure all necessary information is collected
- Educate homeowners on the claim process and give the realistic timeline expectations of when the emergency and rebuild work will be completed
- Ensure industry KPIs are met or exceeded
- Create an estimate for each job in Xactimate
- Daily communication with the Project Managers Assistant on job updates, budgets, concerns, and to ensure timelines are being met
- Manage multiple projects at a time
- Perform site visits and ensure safety standards are met
- Perform bi-weekly Work in Progress meetings and Compliance meetings with the Project Managers Assistant
- Build new relationships with the industry personnel such as insurance adjusters, brokers, and subtrades
- Remain current with market pricing for materials, supplies & labour
- Review all final estimates to confirm accuracy of work completed
- Manage costs to ensure projects are completed on budget
- Assist accounting staff with unpaid invoices including following up with clients on overdue accounts
- Send job files for invoicing
• *Team Compensation and Benefits**:
- Ongoing Leadership Development Program and industry events
- One on One mentorship
- Access to Paul Davis University and regular training opportunities
- Cell phone and laptop provided by company
- Health, dental and vision insurance
- Vacation time
- Annual Salary - wage to be discussed, based on experience
- Bonus Pay - based on performance
• *Team Qualifications (Requirements)**:
- Dedication to customer service
- Must be able to prioritize and manage time
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills
- Problem solving and priority management skills.
- Fluent in English
- Valid driver's license
- Have the ability to work overtime, if needed
- Minimum 2 years of restoration and/or construction experience
- Minimum 1 year of previous project management experience
- Proficiency using Outlook, Encircle, Xactanalysis, and Xactimate
- IICRC Certifications are an asset

We are now seeking an eager and detail\-oriented individual to join our team in a Project Manager \& Estimator role in our Residential Department. This would include being that first contact to our Residential clients, creating designs and estimating quotes, overseeing the execution of various types of landscape construction projects so that they are installed within a given time and budget, and most importantly ensuring workmanship is to our standards for customer satisfaction, while maintaining safety and compliance with all relevant regulations. This is a hybrid role between office and project sites, proper time management is critical.
**Skills Required:**
* 3\+ years of experience in landscape construction.
* Strong leadership, communication, and organizational skills. Knowledge of landscape design, construction methods, and materials.
* Expertise in landscape construction, including hardscaping (pavers, retaining walls, water features), softscaping, and site grading.
**Responsibilities:**
* Meet with potential clients in a friendly and efficient manner, gathering required information in order to provide project specific quotes and rough design template.
* Coordinate with office, crew and clients, to ensure that the projects are completed to customer specifications.

* Supervise and provide direction to landscaping crews. Assign tasks, monitor performance, and provide support to ensure the team works efficiently and adheres to project timelines. This may include hands on support on the construction site. Ensure that work is being performed according to specifications, safety standards, and industry best practices. Enforce safety protocols and ensure that all team members follow proper safety procedures, including the use of personal protective equipment (PPE) and safe handling of tools and materials.

* Work with office to create project tracking and budget forms to ensure that projects are completed within financial constraints and products ordered correctly. As well as ensuring that any necessary permits are collected if applicable.

* Inspect work sites regularly to ensure that the quality of work is consistent with design plans and safety regulations. Perform final inspections to ensure the completed project meets all requirements.
*This is a season position, our season typically begins in March and ends mid to late November.*

Are you passionate about delivering IT solutions? Do you have the technical expertise and leadership skills to drive complex projects to success? We want to hear from you if you're ready to take the lead in delivering exceptional results with a dynamic team.
Are you a great communicator? Can you speak in a language people can easily understand and quickly make personal connections to grow relationships?
Do you enjoy a collaborative, supportive team environment? Do you have a passion for helping team members and clients solve problems?
Are you detail\-orientated and able to run and track multiple tasks simultaneously?
I know that is a lot of questions, but is your answer YES to all of them? Then we have the career for you if you have these must\-haves:
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, both written and verbal (in English).
* Client service expertise to deliver legendary service the HUB way.
* Exceptional ability to prioritize and execute tasks under pressure.
* University degree or college diploma in a related field or equivalent practical experience.
* At least five years of delivering IT infrastructure solutions (Microsoft Server, Networking, etc.).
* At least two years of project management experience.
If everything is good, then apply for this position. If you want to go “over the top,” include a link to a quick, less than 3\-minute personal introduction video.
Here is the traditional job posting if you are interested in reading it:
**Job Description**
**Title:** IT Project Manager
**Reports To:** Vice President of Operations
**Summary of Position:**

The IT Project Manager oversees projects and manages a small team, emphasizing strong communication and interpersonal skills. This role involves setting project objectives, planning technical delivery, fostering a positive team environment, and ensuring quality and customer satisfaction.
**Accountabilities:**
* Communicate effectively with project teams and stakeholders.
* Mentor and lead project team members.
* Foster key business relationships with clients and third\-party vendors.
* Lead all project phases from initiation to completion.
* Define and manage project scope, goals, budget and outcomes with leadership and stakeholders.
* Conduct project retrospectives to identify successful practices and areas for improvement.
* Adherence and understanding of HUB’s defined processes and help develop new ones.
* Maintaining a commitment to business quality and delivering legendary client service.
* Resolving client inquiries expeditiously and professionally.
* Efficient communication skills, in both written and verbal forms, to keep clients and management aware of work status, progress, and problem\-resolution
* Ensure accurate data entry in HUB’s Professional Service Automation software.
* Maintain a clean and safe work environment.
* Adhere to HUB’s timekeeping and attendance policies.
* Work at HUB’s office during regular business hours, Monday to Friday from 8:30 am to 5:00 pm CST except holidays.
* Uphold HUB’s Employee Code of Conduct.
**Qualifications:**
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, both written and verbal, in English.
* Client service expertise is essential.
* Exceptional ability to prioritize and execute tasks under pressure.
* At least five years of delivering IT infrastructure solutions (Microsoft Server, Networking, etc).
* University degree or college diploma in a related field or equivalent practical experience.
* At least two years of direct project management experience.
* PMI certifications are highly regarded.
* Microsoft Certifications (e.g. MCSE) are preferred.
* Valid Manitoba Class 5F Driver’s License and access to a vehicle for company use.
* Legal entitlement to work in Canada.
**Performance Evaluation:**
Performance evaluations will be conducted at least every 90 days, and potential adjustments to salary or compensation will be assessed by the company at its discretion.
**About Us:**
HUB began in 1991 because our CEO, Troy McLennan, realized how much business owners struggled to understand and use IT to their advantage. Instead, it was stressful and complicated.
As a business owner, Troy experienced sleepless nights, worrying about technology, frustrated about unresolved issues, and stressed about investing in tech but not getting value from it.

We are a team of innovative information technology experts committed to removing your IT burden and communicating with you in a language you can understand. Our motto is: Technology is complicated. It is hard for you to keep up, and that is frustrating. HUB Technology Solutions makes technology simple and stress\-free.

If you want to demonstrate your attention to detail, add the word ""kaizen"" anywhere in our cover letter or resume.",,https://ca.indeed.com/cmp/Hub-Technology-Solutions-Ltd,,,,,,,project manager,2025-01-29

About MOBIA

MOBIA Technology Innovations is a Canadian\-owned business and systems integrator with over 37 years of experience. We serve our clients and the Canadian market through five specialized business units: Broadband and Wireless Services, Managed Services, Hybrid Infrastructure Solutions, Cybersecurity, and Digital Transformation Services.
Our long\-standing relationships with industry\-leading technology partners enable us to deliver innovative solutions that drive positive business outcomes for our clients.
The Opportunity

MOBIA is currently recruiting a Project Manager to join our team remotely. This role is dynamic for a driven professional with strong leadership skills and a customer\-focused approach. You will ensure the successful execution of projects, delivering consistent, on\-time results of the highest quality.
**As a Project Manager, you will play a key role in:**
* Managing customer satisfaction.
* Overseeing project budgets, resource allocation, and vendor relationships.
* Planning, monitoring, and documenting all project phases.
* Delivering results using a traditional waterfall project management approach, ideal for telecom\-related projects.
This position emphasizes resource, task, budget/material, and vendor management. A technical aptitude and background in the Telco Voice/ISP/Broadband network space will be essential to your success.
Key Responsibilities
* Manage a portfolio of telecom technical projects, ranging from small\-scale initiatives to large, complex builds or commissioning projects.
* Develop and maintain project plans, including scope statements, delivery schedules, resource allocation, communication plans, goals, milestones, and deadlines.
* Track project stages, mitigate risks, and escalate roadblocks as necessary.
* Coordinate and oversee all tasks required to initiate, execute, and close projects.
* Provide detailed project documentation, reporting, and follow\-up for internal and external stakeholders.
* Facilitate regular customer meetings and maintain consistent communication with all team members, clients, and stakeholders.
* Ensure completed projects meet specifications and are thoroughly documented.
* Monitor project budgets, track material costs, and ensure compliance with invoice and financial forecasting requirements.
Skills and Qualifications
* A Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Science, or Engineering.
* Minimum of 5 years experience in Project Management, Project Coordination, or Implementation Management.
* Leadership experience and team coaching skills are an asset.
* Experience managing projects using Waterfall methodology
* Technical aptitude in the telecom industry are definite assets
* Proven ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, including schedules and budgets.
* Exceptional communication, relationship\-building, and organizational skills to excel in a fast\-paced environment.
* Proficiency in the MS Office suite and the ability to quickly learn new software.
* Ability to travel as required.
* PMP certification is an asset.
* Bilingualism in French and English is an asset.
Why MOBIA?
At MOBIA, we empower businesses through digital transformation and thought leadership. Our innovative approach has earned us recognition, including:
* Canada’s Best Managed Companies 2023 – Deloitte
* Canada Regional Partner of the Year 2023 – Arctic Wolf
* Canada’s Top Growing Companies 2022 – The Globe and Mail
* Canada’s Top 10 Cyber Security Solutions Providers 2022 – The Cyber Security Review
What We Offer
We value the well\-being and professional growth of our team, providing:
* Comprehensive health and dental insurance.
* Employee Assistance Program.
* RRSP/TFSA contribution programs.
* Professional development opportunities.
* Regular company events fostering fun and community engagement.
Diversity and Inclusion
MOBIA is an Equal Opportunity Employer, celebrating diversity and fostering an inclusive environment for all employees.
How to Apply

We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. BGIS is a leading provider of customized facility management and real estate services. With our combined team of over 6, 500 globally, we relentlessly focus on enabling innovation through the services we deliver, while actively looking for new opportunities that will enable innovation for our clients’ businesses. Globally, we manage over 320 million square feet of client portfolios across 30,000\+ locations in North America, Europe, Middle East, Australia and Asia. Further information is available at www.bgis.com
**SUMMARY**

The **Commissioning Oversight Specialist** provides technical review and recommendations related to design, specifications, construction, and turnover of projects to ensure project quality and the effective integration into building operations and maintenance. The Commissioning Oversight Specialist works with technical team members, third party consultants, and contractors.
**KEY DUTIES \& RESPONSIBILITIES**
**Deliverables**
* Oversee the development, planning and implementation of the commissioning oversight process within project scope, schedule, budget and BGIS/Client procedural requirements.

* As a specialist, provide oversight on basis of design , specifications and drawings including commissioning specifications, contractor engagement, systems start\-up \& performance verification testing coordination, operations, and maintenance documentation.
**Team Support**

* Communicates with Commissioning Oversight Manager, Project Managers, Property Managers, BGIS technical personnel, 3rd party commissioning agents, consultants, and other resources to meet the commissioning oversight deliverables for a project.
* Works as a team to ensure continuous improvement of the commissioning oversight delivery process.
* Provides ongoing operational support to the property team, including building assessments and capital planning support.
* Supports facility operations teams with re\-commissioning and retro commissioning activities.
* Effectively communicates with both internal and external clients
* Skilled in technical report writing.
* Other duties as assigned
**KNOWLEDGE \& SKILLS**
* University or college degree in related field, electrical, mechanical, building systems engineering or building envelope is preferred.
* Experience in building operations.
* Experience in commissioning related activities.
* Familiar with National and Provincial building codes and standards
* Familiar with modern practices and typical building equipment/systems and site services.
* Strong understanding of the construction sector.
* Strong analytical and problem\-solving skills
* Ability to develop, analyze and understand complex processes
* Sound judgement skills based on observation of objective evidence
* Ability to perform with minimum direct supervision
* Ability to communicate in French and English is an asset
**Licenses and/or Professional Accreditation**
* Certified Commissioning Professional from BCxA, ASHRAE or equivalent certification or be able to apply to obtain such certification
* Member of Professional Engineers Association is an asset
* Engineering Technician or College diploma in Engineering technology or any other equivalent designation is an asset
* Valid Driver’s License

At Star Ready to Move Homes, our people make the difference. We offer an exciting place to build your career.
**This is a full\-time role** **for a Project Coordinator student, May through August 2024\.**
**Job Overview**

Reporting to the Branch Manager, as the **Project Coordinator** you are responsible for providing administrative assistance throughout the construction process, and ensuring the efficient flow of documentation and information between systems and departments.
Your day\-to\-day responsibilities will include:
* Managing Request for Information (RFI) and Submittals. Determining project and trade scopes, and preparing Pre\-Construction schedules.
* Liaising with related parties including external vendors, to provide information and project timeline updates when necessary.
* Monitoring day\-to\-day operations to ensure projects are carried out accordingly to standard processes and procedures.
* Developing and maintaining positive relationships with staff and trades.
As our ideal candidate, you are…
* A creative thinker
column2: you identify new ideas, techniques and opportunities to improve performance and productivity.

column1: * A creative problem solver
column2: you think outside the box for solutions without fear of failure.

column1: * Process driven
column2: follow procedures and suggest/implement improvements focused on effective project workflow.

column1: **Essential Requirements**
* Post\-secondary education in Engineering, Project Management, or equivalent.
* Construction or project coordination experience an asset.
* Valid driver’s licence and access to reliable vehicle.
* Satisfactory verification of criminal record check.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office programs (Outlook, Word, Teams, SharePoint and Excel).
**What We Value**
* Creating trusting and successful working relationships.
* Setting clear, measurable and achievable goals.
* Cooperating with team members in an open, positive and respectful manner.
* Staying current with technical job skills.
* Taking responsibility for the outcomes of decisions and actions.
* Consistently meeting customer expectations.
**Work Conditions**
You primarily work in an office setting during regular business hours.
**About Us**

Star Ready to Move Homes, a division of Star Building Materials, is an industry leader for construction of RTM homes for over 30 years in Manitoba and Saskatchewan. We build cottages and homes as well as garage packages with industry leading structural warrant and specifications. Star RTM has a team of 19 employees in Administration, Sales, Design Drafting and Production. Our production team has over 60 years of combined residential construction experience! Come work with us this summer!

**Full\-Time Summer Internship Position**
**Start date**: April (Flexible), **End Date**: End of August
**Closing date:** March 31, 2025

The Professional Intern – Human Resources works closely with several business operations within Birchwood. The successful candidate will assist the Learning and Development team, HR Services and Recruitment team with day\-to\-day activities within Birchwood. This role provides a valuable opportunity for individuals seeking to complete their Human Resources degree and pursue their CPHR designation.
This position will be a part of the Birchwood Professional Intern program where students will:
* Network and connect with other intern students
* Participate in leadership and professional development training
**What you will do:**
· Birchwood’s United Way campaign – design, develop a plan and help execute team member engagement
· Analyze data to uncover valuable insights that enhance learning and development strategies.
· Develop creative skills by designing engaging eLearning content for our team members.
· Gain hands\-on experience with HRIS and LMS systems, building sought\-after skills for today’s job market.
· Work on real projects that directly impact the success of our Sales \& Service teams.
· Collaborate with experienced HR and L\&D professionals, gaining mentorship and industry knowledge.
· Contribute to a dynamic and supportive work environment that strengthens your resume.
· Support recruitment efforts by posting job openings, screening resumes, and coordinating interviews.
· Assist with onboarding by preparing paperwork and organizing orientation materials.
**Qualifications:**
· Pursuing post\-secondary education in the field of Human Resources
· Knowledge of basic Human Resources theories and best practices
· Ability to troubleshoot quickly, identify trends and recommend solutions
· Ability to thrive in a collaborative environment and work on cross\-functional teams
· High attention to detail, proven time management, and organizational skills
· Working knowledge of Microsoft and other applications
· Valid 5F driver's license and own transportation to and from work as some Birchwood locations are not on a bus route
· The Learning and Development team is located out of the Birchwood Ford on Regent Ave

Birchwood is Manitoba’s largest automotive retailer network. Our 23 franchises include two state\-of\-the\-art collision repair centres and four Birchwood Credit Solutions locations, and offer sales, services, and parts to meet our customers’ automotive needs. We’re a recognized leader in the retail automotive industry, not only for our diverse workforce reflecting our community, but also for our unparalleled commitment to team members, customers, partners, and neighborhoods. At Birchwood, our days begin and end with gratitude, personal leadership, trust, respect, continuous improvement, and generosity.

Birchwood is committed to creating a diverse workplace and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-01-29

zr-c2qRaIzMFzkUVd0K6d9RdQ,zip_recruiter,https://www.ziprecruiter.com/jobs//j?lvk=c2qRaIzMFzkUVd0K6d9RdQ,,Engineering Manager for IAM (Identity and Access Management),Canonical - Jobs,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-28,,,,,,,,,,organic,,"Canonical is seeking an experienced engineering manager to build high\-performing Go and Python services and secure identity and access management solutions that will be used across all company products. From Ubuntu One SSO to Juju, LXD and MAAS your team will define the way Canonical users, clients and community members access their favorite open source applications.

This is an opportunity for a software engineering manager with a passion for distributed systems operations to help us transform the future of identity management at Canonical. Experience in the identity and access management (IAM) field is desirable but not required. You will work with upstream open source projects, alongside internal teams to deliver high quality software that can be deployed on bare metal, public cloud and Kubernetes.

As the identity team engineering manager you will bring significant software development experience, Kubernetes knowledge and a keen eye for software design, performance and security. You will be responsible for working with product management to define the technical vision for the products, managing the team backlog, reviewing code and coaching younger team members.

You will also be involved in all the aspects of the software development process: you will design software, write high\-quality code and tests, provide insightful code reviews, write documentation and help to troubleshoot issues.

In addition to the engineering behind the project itself, you'll have the chance to work with industry\-leading teams inside Canonical, ensuring your work is backed by rock\-solid data stores, and highly observable using our Kubernetes\-based Observability stack. You'll work with broader open source communities, participating in ""hackfest"" events, webinars and conferences.
Who you are* Proven experience hiring and leading a high performance software engineering team
* Experience with Go and Python software development
* Ability to design and implement complex, distributed system
* Experience working with container technology and Kubernetes
* Strong understanding of software/infrastructure security and performance
* Experience designing and/or operating large scale distributed systems
* Knowledge of identity and access management technologies and standards is desirable but not essential

Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open\-source community to deliver Ubuntu, the world's best free software platform. Our services help businesses worldwide reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.

*We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your**identity* *we will give your application fair consideration.*
\#LI\-remote",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-01-29

Shared Health leads the planning and coordinates the integration of patient\-centered clinical and preventive health services across Manitoba. The organization also delivers some province\-wide health services and supports centralized administrative and business functions for Manitoba health organizations.
**Position Overview**

Under the general direction of the Laboratory Supervisor/Manager/Director or Designate, the Charge Medical Laboratory Technologist is responsible for the daily operation of their section of the laboratory. Areas of responsibility will include administrative, supervisory, technical and educational. The incumbent will maintain a safe environment in accordance with professional and provincial guidelines and ensure compliance with quality assurance programs and maintain standards put forth by Accreditation. Functions are conducted in accordance with the Mission and Values of Shared Health Diagnostic Services, current policies, procedures and applicable legislation.
**Experience**
* Minimum five years' recent extensive work experience in a related area including supervisory and/or administrative experience required.
**Education (Degree/Diploma/Certificate)**
* Graduate of an approved Medical Laboratory Technology program.
* Successful completion of the CMLTM Prior Learning Assessment process for a discipline specialty, as deemed by the Employer may also be considered.
* Advanced academic achievement (e.g., A.R.T. or B.Sc.) preferred.
* Relevant courses or seminars preferred.
**Certification/Licensure/Registration**
* Current registration or eligible for registration with the College of Medical Laboratory Technologists of Manitoba (CMLTM) required.
* Current membership with the Canadian Society for Medical Laboratory Science (CSMLS) considered an asset.
**Qualifications and Skills**
* Must be able to communicate effectively in English, both written and oral.
* Windows computer environment required.
* Microsoft Office programs required.
* Workplace Health and Safety Program or training preferred.
* Leadership skills to coordinate workflow, supervise and promote teamwork.
* Communication skills to handle professionally all lab communications and interactions with other health care professionals at various levels from both within and outside the laboratory.
* Apply technical knowledge to interpretation of results, troubleshooting, and assessing of methods.
* Follow oral and written instructions precisely with attention to detail.
* Demonstrated effective oral and written communication skills required.
* Demonstrated ability to work both independently and as a team member.
* Proficient analytical skills.
* Work under pressure.
* Maintains confidentiality with all information entrusted to the position.
* Fluent language skills (written and oral) in both French and English may be required.
* Ability to perform duties as described.
**Physical Requirements**
* Working shifts, weekends, and holidays may be required.
* Participating in standby and callback duty may be required.

* Exposure to all hazards and dangers incumbent in working in a laboratory. For more definitive information, refer to the Job Hazard Analysis. Assessment of this position within the specific laboratory.

Shared Health leads the planning and coordinates the integration of patient\-centered clinical and preventive health services across Manitoba. The organization also delivers some province\-wide health services and supports centralized administrative and business functions for Manitoba health organizations.

This position will also require duties / testing associated with the Hematology discipline which will be performed while the incumbent is working in the St. Boniface Hospital Emergency Laboratory on a rotational basis. All applicable training and relevant competencies will be provided by the Employer.
**Position Overview**

Under the general supervision of the Charge or designate, the General Duty Medical Laboratory Technologist is responsible for clinical analysis and reporting on patient samples according to established protocols. The General Duty Medical Laboratory Technologist is also responsible for assisting in general lab projects such as SOPs, chemical inventories, etc. The incumbent will maintain a safe environment in accordance with professional and provincial guidelines and ensure compliance with quality assurance programs and maintain standards put forth by Accreditation. Functions are conducted in accordance with the Mission and Values of Shared Health Diagnostic Services, current policies, procedures and applicable legislation.
**Experience**
* Previous related experience preferred.
**Education (Degree/Diploma/Certificate)**
* Graduate of an approved Medical Laboratory Technology program.
* Successful completion of the CMLTM Prior Learning Assessment process for a discipline specialty, as deemed by the Employer may also be considered.
**Certification/Licensure/Registration**
* Current registration or eligible for registration with the College of Medical Laboratory Technologists of Manitoba (CMLTM) required.
* Current membership with the Canadian Society for Medical Laboratory Science (CSMLS) considered an asset.
**Qualifications and Skills**
* Must be able to communicate effectively in English, both written and oral.
* Windows computer environment required.
* Microsoft Office programs preferred.
* Follow oral and written instructions precisely with attention to detail.
* Demonstrated ability to work both independently and as a team member.
* Proficient analytical skills.
* Work under pressure.
* Maintains confidentiality with all information entrusted to the position.
* Fluent language skill (written and oral) in both French may be required.
* Ability to perform duties as described.
**Physical Requirements**
* Working shifts, weekends and holidays may be required.
* Participating in standby and callback duty may be required.
* Rotate through various workstations as required.
* Exposure to all hazards and dangers incumbent in working in a laboratory.
* For more definitive information, refer to the Job Hazard Analysis Assessment of this position within the specific laboratory.
