Reporting to the Finance Director, the Facilities Maintenance Manager will be responsible for ensuring that MSP facilities are operated and maintained in a safe, efficient and effective manner. Managing supplies, cleaning and staff. This position will have a lead role in project management of structural capital projects (new and existing buildings).This position works collaboratively with internal stakeholders, trade / construction professionals.
• *KEY RESULT AREAS**
• *Daily Maintenance Services**

Lead and supervise delivery of highly efficient and effective daily maintenance services for MSP buildings. Fully understand the operation, features, strengths, and shortcomings of existing facilities.

Make recommendations that will increase ease of use for MSP staff and clients. Develop metrics and key performance indicators for maintenance services. Work cooperatively to ensure cohesive and consistent customer service. Manage annual operating budget for facility repairs and maintenance.
• *Agency-Wide Maintenance Plan**

Lead in development of a proactive maintenance plan that describes current conditions of MSP buildings and facilities. The plan shall make recommendations for each building and its individual building systems with respect to projected remaining service life and estimated costs to repair, renovate, or replace. Be a champion for the development within MSP of a detailed facilities management database of MSP owned/operated buildings. The database shall track size and detailed condition within each building.
These databases shall be maintained current at all times. Database will provide a variety of facilities space utilization and conditions reports to the Finance Director.

Create and routinely provide reports that measure and monitor the maintenance activities and costs.

Track maintenance and facility improvement projects by type and regularly report progress on schedules, costs, scope etc. Make recommendations for continual improvement. Be active in professional organizations to learn of new best practices.

go-CZ3yrlwDTdHPkkdyAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-proposal-writer-at-colliers-project-leaders-canada-4099649635?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Senior Proposal Writer,Colliers Project Leaders | Canada,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-14,,,,,,,False,,,,,"Overview

At Colliers Project Leaders, we de liver capital project solutions to fulfill our clients’ needs across the built environment. The work we do makes a difference in communities and for the people who live there. We have a passion for it.

Our commitment to realizing our clients' vision inspires us to look beyond the immediate – to the possibilities of what we can achieve together. We are 18,000 projects and counting – improving lives and helping shape the growth of sustainable, progressive and inclusive communities.
Your role
Join our team as a Senior Proposal Writer with our Proposals Team!

As the Senior Proposal Writer, you are responsible for telling the story of how we can help our clients meet their real property needs. You lead the timely delivery of proposals for various internal teams, writing, editing, coordinating, and formatting content into clear submissions that are responsive to the client’s requirements.

Using your organizational and communication skills, you manage the many moving parts of a submission, by working effectively with a wide range of people, developing strong working relationships with your teams as you do so.
Responsibilities
• Lead the development of professional, high-quality, compelling proposals that effectively educate and inspire action on the part of customers and prospects

• Strategically manage the proposal response from receipt of RFP to the delivery of the final product, including writing content and editing submissions to ensure the proposal is accurate, concise, and effective
• Define and manage the proposal response plan, schedule, and internal communications associated with the proposal development including follow-up with the contributors
• Identify and voice concerns associated with the proposal preparation process and response, as related to issues of compliance and risk
• Actively participate in and lead proposal strategy meetings, researching internal and external information, and distilling into win strategies to be executed in your proposal response
• Participate in trend analysis, proposal debriefings and other similar opportunities to ensure continuous quality improvement and to identify enhancements for proposal content and process
• Support collaboration across the Proposal Team, through updates to our proposal systems and databases of content
Qualifications

• Minimum of 5 years of experience in in reading and responding to Request for Proposal (RFP) documents and developing proposal / bid submissions that respond to their requirements, ideally in the Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC) and/or the professional services industries
• A post-secondary education in Communications, Marketing, English, Writing, Journalism or equivalent field of study
• Advanced working knowledge of MS Office products with strong Word proficiency
• Exceptional business writing, editing, and proofreading skills
• Working knowledge of Adobe Creative Suites software, in particular InDesign, is a strong asset.
Approximate Base Salary Range for Role: $80,000 CAD to $95,000 CAD.

Base Salary pay ranges are determined by role, level, and location and reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire base salaries for the position. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Annual bonus opportunities are in addition to base salary.

Don’t have every single qualification? We know that some people are less likely to apply for a job unless they are a perfect match. At Colliers Project Leaders, we’re not looking for “perfect matches.” We’re looking to welcome people to our diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. So, if you’re excited about this role but don’t have every single qualification, we encourage you to apply anyway. Whether it’s this role or another one, you may be just the right candidate.
What You Can Expect
• An opportunity to truly impact our communities
• A flexible work environment
• A comprehensive onboarding experience
• Significant professional development, training, and a mentorship program
• A paid volunteer day
• An environment where people feel welcome, heard and included, regardless of their differences
• And much more!
Join our team of difference-makers and help shape the growth of dynamic communities.
Disclaimer

Colliers Project Leaders is part of Colliers (NASDAQ, TSX: CIGI), a leading diversified professional services and investment management company, with more than 17,000 professionals operating in 63 countries.
Colliers Project Leaders has suspended our COVID-19 vaccination requirement. In circumstances where our clients have a different COVID-19 vaccination policy, the Clients’ requirements will supersede.

Colliers Project Leaders is an equal opportunity employer and celebrates diversity in its workforce. Colliers encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants' disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. If you require a disability-related accommodation to participate in the recruitment process, please advise the assigned Talent Acquisition Business Partner.
Colliers Project Leaders standard recruitment process requires applicants to be subjected to formal background and reference checks prior to their hiring.",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-01-29

BGIS is a leading provider of customized facility management and real estate services. With our combined team of over 6, 500 globally, we relentlessly focus on enabling innovation through the services we deliver, while actively looking for new opportunities that will enable innovation for our clients' businesses. Globally, we manage over 320 million square feet of client portfolios across 30,000+ locations in North America, Europe, Middle East, Australia and Asia. Further information is available at www.bgis.com
SUMMARY

The Commissioning Oversight Specialist provides technical review and recommendations related to design, specifications, construction, and turnover of projects to ensure project quality and the effective integration into building operations and maintenance. The Commissioning Oversight Specialist works with technical team members, third party consultants, and contractors.
KEY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Deliverables
• Oversee the development, planning and implementation of the commissioning oversight process within project scope, schedule, budget and BGIS/Client procedural requirements.

• As a specialist, provide oversight on basis of design , specifications and drawings including commissioning specifications, contractor engagement, systems start-up & performance verification testing coordination, operations, and maintenance documentation.
Team Support

• Communicates with Commissioning Oversight Manager, Project Managers, Property Managers, BGIS technical personnel, 3rd party commissioning agents, consultants, and other resources to meet the commissioning oversight deliverables for a project.
• Works as a team to ensure continuous improvement of the commissioning oversight delivery process.
• Provides ongoing operational support to the property team, including building assessments and capital planning support.
• Supports facility operations teams with re-commissioning and retro commissioning activities.
• Effectively communicates with both internal and external clients
• Skilled in technical report writing.
• Other duties as assigned
KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS
• University or college degree in related field, electrical, mechanical, building systems engineering or building envelope is preferred.
• Experience in building operations.
• Experience in commissioning related activities.
• Familiar with National and Provincial building codes and standards
• Familiar with modern practices and typical building equipment/systems and site services.
• Strong understanding of the construction sector.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
• Ability to develop, analyze and understand complex processes
• Sound judgement skills based on observation of objective evidence
• Ability to perform with minimum direct supervision
• Ability to communicate in French and English is an asset
Licenses and/or Professional Accreditation
• Certified Commissioning Professional from BCxA, ASHRAE or equivalent certification or be able to apply to obtain such certification
• Member of Professional Engineers Association is an asset
• Engineering Technician or College diploma in Engineering technology or any other equivalent designation is an asset
• Valid Driver's License

go-85kEaAtksQRcdLTAAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-b4d22119783b527c3ea33898e7736e71?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Restoration Project Manager,"Paul Davis Winnipeg, MB","Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-13,,,,,,,True,,,,,"**About us**

Across North America, Paul Davis is helping families and businesses repair their properties and pick up the pieces following an emergency. • *Position**: Restoration Project Manager
• *Reports To**:General Manager
• *General Description**

As a Project Manager, you will manage the renovation, as well as control and communicate the budget effectively. This means you will spend a good deal of time in the field to see your projects get completed properly. You will act as a liaison between the Insurance Company and the Property Owner/Manager, managing the claim from start to finish, ensuring each project runs smoothly. This position requires an individual who is organized and committed to being successful. Strong leadership and people management skills are a must as is the ability to communicate effectively with both clients and management.

Due to the nature of our work and the demands of our clients, flexible working hours are required though a typical work week is Monday-Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. You will also be required to participate in the weekly On-Call Rotation.
• *Nature & Scope**
Performs a variety of in duties including:
- Accept claims directly from insurance adjusters and brokers
- Perform site inspections, assess damages, accurately measure and sketch areas, take photos and upload to Encircle software, and ensure all necessary information is collected
- Educate homeowners on the claim process and give the realistic timeline expectations of when the emergency and rebuild work will be completed
- Ensure industry KPIs are met or exceeded
- Create an estimate for each job in Xactimate
- Daily communication with the Project Managers Assistant on job updates, budgets, concerns, and to ensure timelines are being met
- Manage multiple projects at a time
- Perform site visits and ensure safety standards are met
- Perform bi-weekly Work in Progress meetings and Compliance meetings with the Project Managers Assistant
- Build new relationships with the industry personnel such as insurance adjusters, brokers, and subtrades
- Remain current with market pricing for materials, supplies & labour
- Review all final estimates to confirm accuracy of work completed
- Manage costs to ensure projects are completed on budget
- Assist accounting staff with unpaid invoices including following up with clients on overdue accounts
- Send job files for invoicing
• *Team Compensation and Benefits**:
- Ongoing Leadership Development Program and industry events
- One on One mentorship
- Access to Paul Davis University and regular training opportunities
- Cell phone and laptop provided by company
- Health, dental and vision insurance
- Vacation time
- Annual Salary - wage to be discussed, based on experience
- Bonus Pay - based on performance
• *Team Qualifications (Requirements)**:
- Dedication to customer service
- Must be able to prioritize and manage time
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills
- Problem solving and priority management skills.
- Fluent in English
- Valid driver's license
- Have the ability to work overtime, if needed
- Minimum 2 years of restoration and/or construction experience
- Minimum 1 year of previous project management experience
- Proficiency using Outlook, Encircle, Xactanalysis, and Xactimate
- IICRC Certifications are an asset
Work remotely
- No
• *Job Types**: Full-time, Permanent

At Wood Products Unlimited, we take pride in being more than just a woodworking company in Winnipeg. We specialize in manufacturing and installing custom kitchens, closets, and millwork. Our commitment to excellence extends beyond our products. We believe in valuing people and relationships.

For us, business is all about building and nurturing relationships. We understand that work is an essential part of life, but life is not all about work. That's why we've implemented a 10-hour, four-day workweek. Our work hours run from Monday to Thursday, allowing our team to enjoy Fridays off. We've made this choice to reduce driving time, provide more personal time for our dedicated employees, and foster a balanced and fulfilling life.
• *Position Details**:

Full-time, 6-Month Term, Monday to Thursday, 7:00 am - 5:00 pm (Schedule hours and wages are negotiable). The temporary position could potentially turn into a permanent role based on performance and business needs.
• *Responsibilities**:
- Create precise shop drawings using Mozaik based on design team input and site measurements.
- Detect and rectify any issues that may arise during the drawing preparation process.
- Utilize drawings to prepare quotes and actively participate in the quoting process with customers.
- Order materials necessary for projects.
- Maintain effective communication with fellow drafters, production staff, residential, and commercial customers.
• *Skills and Abilities**:
- Proficiency in technical drawing software, such as AutoCAD or Mozaik (reflecting the software used at WPU).
- Experience creating shop drawings and architectural drawings.
- Understanding of furniture design and architectural principles.
- Ability to interpret and work from technical specifications and blueprints.
- Strong attention to detail and accuracy in drawings.
- Strong communication skills with the capacity to collaborate effectively within a team.
- Experience with 3D modeling software is a plus.
- Ideally, possess a diploma or certificate in drafting or a related field.

If you are a skilled Drafter and Project Coordinator looking to join a dynamic team in the woodworking industry, we encourage you to apply. Your expertise will play a vital role in delivering high-quality custom furniture and cabinetry projects for our clients. We look forward to having you on board to help us achieve our mission of customer satisfaction and excellence in woodworking.
• *Salary**: From $18.00 per hour
• *Benefits**:
- Company events
- Flexible schedule
- On-site parking
Flexible Language Requirement:
- French not required
Schedule:
- 10 hour shift
- Day shift
Supplemental pay types:
- Overtime pay

- Drafting: 1 year (required)
Work Location: In person",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-01-29

Are you detail\-orientated and able to run and track multiple tasks simultaneously?
I know that is a lot of questions, but is your answer YES to all of them? Then we have the career for you if you have these must\-haves:
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, both written and verbal (in English).
* Client service expertise to deliver legendary service the HUB way.
* Exceptional ability to prioritize and execute tasks under pressure.
* University degree or college diploma in a related field or equivalent practical experience.
* At least five years of delivering IT infrastructure solutions (Microsoft Server, Networking, etc.).
* At least two years of project management experience.
If everything is good, then apply for this position. If you want to go “over the top,” include a link to a quick, less than 3\-minute personal introduction video.
Here is the traditional job posting if you are interested in reading it:
**Job Description**
**Title:** IT Project Manager
**Reports To:** Vice President of Operations
**Summary of Position:**

The IT Project Manager oversees projects and manages a small team, emphasizing strong communication and interpersonal skills. This role involves setting project objectives, planning technical delivery, fostering a positive team environment, and ensuring quality and customer satisfaction.
**Accountabilities:**
* Communicate effectively with project teams and stakeholders.
* Mentor and lead project team members.
* Foster key business relationships with clients and third\-party vendors.
* Lead all project phases from initiation to completion.
* Define and manage project scope, goals, budget and outcomes with leadership and stakeholders.
* Conduct project retrospectives to identify successful practices and areas for improvement.
* Adherence and understanding of HUB’s defined processes and help develop new ones.
* Maintaining a commitment to business quality and delivering legendary client service.
* Resolving client inquiries expeditiously and professionally.
* Efficient communication skills, in both written and verbal forms, to keep clients and management aware of work status, progress, and problem\-resolution
* Ensure accurate data entry in HUB’s Professional Service Automation software.
* Maintain a clean and safe work environment.
* Adhere to HUB’s timekeeping and attendance policies.
* Work at HUB’s office during regular business hours, Monday to Friday from 8:30 am to 5:00 pm CST except holidays.
* Uphold HUB’s Employee Code of Conduct.
**Qualifications:**
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, both written and verbal, in English.
* Client service expertise is essential.
* Exceptional ability to prioritize and execute tasks under pressure.
* At least five years of delivering IT infrastructure solutions (Microsoft Server, Networking, etc).
* University degree or college diploma in a related field or equivalent practical experience.
* At least two years of direct project management experience.
* PMI certifications are highly regarded.
* Microsoft Certifications (e.g. MCSE) are preferred.
* Valid Manitoba Class 5F Driver’s License and access to a vehicle for company use.
* Legal entitlement to work in Canada.
**Performance Evaluation:**
Performance evaluations will be conducted at least every 90 days, and potential adjustments to salary or compensation will be assessed by the company at its discretion.
**About Us:**
HUB began in 1991 because our CEO, Troy McLennan, realized how much business owners struggled to understand and use IT to their advantage. Instead, it was stressful and complicated.
As a business owner, Troy experienced sleepless nights, worrying about technology, frustrated about unresolved issues, and stressed about investing in tech but not getting value from it.

We are a team of innovative information technology experts committed to removing your IT burden and communicating with you in a language you can understand. Our motto is: Technology is complicated. It is hard for you to keep up, and that is frustrating. HUB Technology Solutions makes technology simple and stress\-free.

If you want to demonstrate your attention to detail, add the word ""kaizen"" anywhere in our cover letter or resume.",,https://ca.indeed.com/cmp/Hub-Technology-Solutions-Ltd,,,,,,,project manager,2025-01-29

Our Client is an industry leader in the drywall, roofing and siding business and is looking to bring on a leader for their siding division based in Edmonton, Alberta! **Operations Manager \- Siding** is responsible for overseeing and optimizing the operations of the siding division, driving its growth and ensuring seamless project execution. This role focuses on managing day\-to\-day activities, leading Project Managers, Site Supervisors, Labor teams, and Estimators, while implementing strategies to enhance productivity, profitability, and customer satisfaction.

With an emphasis on residential and commercial projects, the Operations Manager will collaborate with Architects, Specifiers, Developers, Contractors, Engineers, and Designers to support project requirements and position the company as a leader in siding solutions. As the primary liaison with vendor representatives, the role ensures strong partnerships to achieve competitive pricing and exceptional quality standards.
**Key Responsibilities**
**Operational Leadership**
* Oversee all aspects of the siding division's operations, including scheduling, inventory management, custom order processing, and project coordination.
* Develop and implement operational strategies to enhance efficiency, ensure on\-time delivery, and exceed client expectations.
* Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure operational success and identify areas for improvement.
* Ensure compliance with health and safety standards across all projects and worksites.
* Manage vendor relationships, ensuring timely procurement of materials at competitive prices.
**Project Management**
* Supervise the planning and execution of siding projects from inception to completion, ensuring alignment with budgets, timelines, and quality standards.
* Coordinate with project coordinators, site supervisors, and labor teams to ensure smooth project workflows.
* Oversee estimators in preparing accurate take\-offs and quotes for siding projects.
* Address project challenges proactively, resolving issues to maintain client satisfaction and operational efficiency.
**Strategic Growth**
* Contribute to the division’s growth by identifying new business opportunities and areas for market expansion.
* Collaborate with senior management to align operational goals with overall business objectives.
* Drive innovation within the division by exploring new products, technologies, and methods to enhance competitiveness.
**Requirements**
**Experience**
* 10\+ years of experience in operations management, construction, or a related field, with a proven track record of delivering results in a fast\-paced environment.
* Extensive experience in project management, preferably within the building materials, siding, or construction industry.
* Strong project management skills, with the ability to oversee multiple projects simultaneously.
* Solid understanding of construction processes, siding products, and building methods is highly desirable.
* Demonstrated ability to lead and inspire teams, fostering a culture of accountability and excellence.
* Strong relationship\-building skills to work effectively with internal teams, clients, and vendors.
* Proficient in MS Office, CRM, and ERP systems.
* Highly organized with strong time management and problem\-solving skills.
**Education and Training**
* Post\-secondary education in business, construction management, or a related field preferred.
* Formal training in operations, project management, or construction is an asset.
**Compensation and Benefits**
* Competitive base salary.
* Annual incentive plan tied to company performance.
* Comprehensive health benefits.
* Vehicle allowance.",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-01-29

zr-x13PNK7jpSmZeQ0pwJ5tEQ,zip_recruiter,https://www.ziprecruiter.com/jobs//j?lvk=x13PNK7jpSmZeQ0pwJ5tEQ,,IT Project Manager,HUB Technology Solutions Ltd,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-28,fulltime,,,,,,,,,organic,,"Salary: $37 to $43/hour
**IT Project Manager**

Are you passionate about delivering IT solutions? Do you have the technical expertise and leadership skills to drive complex projects to success? We want to hear from you if you're ready to take the lead in delivering exceptional results with a dynamic team.
Are you a great communicator? Can you speak in a language people can easily understand and quickly make personal connections to grow relationships?
Do you enjoy a collaborative, supportive team environment? Do you have a passion for helping team members and clients solve problems?
Are you detail\-orientated and able to run and track multiple tasks simultaneously?
I know that is a lot of questions, but is your answer YES to all of them? Then we have the career for you if you have these must\-haves:
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, both written and verbal (in English).
Client service expertise to deliver legendary service the HUB way.
Exceptional ability to prioritize and execute tasks under pressure.
University degree or college diploma in a related field or equivalent practical experience.
At least five years of delivering IT infrastructure solutions (Microsoft Server, Networking, etc.).
At least two years of project management experience.
If everything is good, then apply for this position.If you want to go over the top, include a link to a quick, less than 3\-minute personal introduction video.
Here is the traditional job posting if you are interested in reading it:
**Job Description**
**Title:**IT Project Manager
**Reports To:**Vice President of Operations
**Summary of Position:**

The IT Project Manager oversees projects and manages a small team, emphasizing strong communication and interpersonal skills. This role involves setting project objectives, planning technical delivery, fostering a positive team environment, and ensuring quality and customer satisfaction.
**Accountabilities:**
Communicate effectively with project teams and stakeholders.
Mentor and lead project team members.
Foster key business relationships with clients and third\-party vendors.
Lead all project phases from initiation to completion.
Define and manage project scope, goals, budget and outcomes with leadership and stakeholders.
Conduct project retrospectives to identify successful practices and areas for improvement.
Adherence and understanding of HUBs defined processes and help develop new ones.
Maintaining a commitment to business quality and delivering legendary client service.
Resolving client inquiries expeditiously and professionally.
Efficient communication skills, in both written and verbal forms, to keep clients and management aware of work status, progress, and problem\-resolution
Ensure accurate data entry in HUBs Professional Service Automation software.
Maintain a clean and safe work environment.
Adhere to HUBs timekeeping and attendance policies.
Work at HUBs office during regular business hours, Monday to Friday from 8:30 am to 5:00 pm CST except holidays.
Uphold HUBs Employee Code of Conduct.
**Qualifications:**
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, both written and verbal, in English.
Client service expertise is essential.
Exceptional ability to prioritize and execute tasks under pressure.
At least five years of delivering IT infrastructure solutions (Microsoft Server, Networking, etc).
University degree or college diploma in a related field or equivalent practical experience.
At least two years of direct project management experience.
PMI certifications are highly regarded.
Microsoft Certifications (e.g. MCSE) are preferred.
Valid Manitoba Class 5F Drivers License and access to a vehicle for company use.
Legal entitlement to work in Canada.
**Performance Evaluation:**
Performance evaluations will be conducted at least every 90 days, and potential adjustments to salary or compensation will be assessed by the company at its discretion.
**About Us:**
HUB began in 1991 because our CEO, Troy McLennan, realized how much business owners struggled to understand and use IT to their advantage. Instead, it was stressful and complicated.
As a business owner, Troy experienced sleepless nights, worrying about technology, frustrated about unresolved issues, and stressed about investing in tech but not getting value from it.

We are a team of innovative information technology experts committed to removing your IT burden and communicating with you in a language you can understand. Our motto is: Technology is complicated. It is hard for you to keep up, and that is frustrating. HUB Technology Solutions makes technology simple and stress\-free.
If you want to demonstrate your attention to detail, add the word ""kaizen"" anywhere in our cover letter or resume.",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-01-29

zr-c2qRaIzMFzkUVd0K6d9RdQ,zip_recruiter,https://www.ziprecruiter.com/jobs//j?lvk=c2qRaIzMFzkUVd0K6d9RdQ,,Engineering Manager for IAM (Identity and Access Management),Canonical - Jobs,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-28,,,,,,,,,,organic,,"Canonical is seeking an experienced engineering manager to build high\-performing Go and Python services and secure identity and access management solutions that will be used across all company products. From Ubuntu One SSO to Juju, LXD and MAAS your team will define the way Canonical users, clients and community members access their favorite open source applications.

This is an opportunity for a software engineering manager with a passion for distributed systems operations to help us transform the future of identity management at Canonical. Experience in the identity and access management (IAM) field is desirable but not required. You will work with upstream open source projects, alongside internal teams to deliver high quality software that can be deployed on bare metal, public cloud and Kubernetes.

As the identity team engineering manager you will bring significant software development experience, Kubernetes knowledge and a keen eye for software design, performance and security. You will be responsible for working with product management to define the technical vision for the products, managing the team backlog, reviewing code and coaching younger team members.

You will also be involved in all the aspects of the software development process: you will design software, write high\-quality code and tests, provide insightful code reviews, write documentation and help to troubleshoot issues.

In addition to the engineering behind the project itself, you'll have the chance to work with industry\-leading teams inside Canonical, ensuring your work is backed by rock\-solid data stores, and highly observable using our Kubernetes\-based Observability stack. You'll work with broader open source communities, participating in ""hackfest"" events, webinars and conferences.

* Experience with Go and Python software development
* Ability to design and implement complex, distributed system
* Experience working with container technology and Kubernetes
* Strong understanding of software/infrastructure security and performance
* Experience designing and/or operating large scale distributed systems
* Knowledge of identity and access management technologies and standards is desirable but not essential

Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open\-source community to deliver Ubuntu, the world's best free software platform. Our services help businesses worldwide reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.
